      <title>The Famous History of the Life of Henry the Eighth</title>

      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Famous History of the Life of Henry the Eighth</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">
               <p>
                  <b>Table of Contents</b>
               </p>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           <span>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>

         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING HENRY the Eighth</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CARDINAL WOLSEY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CAPUCIUS, Ambassador from the Emperor Charles V.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CRANMER, Archbishop of Canterbury.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF NORFOLK</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF BUCKINGHAM</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF SUFFOLK</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">EARL OF SURREY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lord Chamberlain</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lord Chancellor</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">GARDINER, Bishop of Winchester.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Bishop of Lincoln. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD ABERGAVENNY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LORD SANDS</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR HENRY GUILDFORD</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR THOMAS LOVELL</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR ANTHONY DENNY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR NICHOLAS VAUX</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Secretaries to Wolsey.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CROMWELL, Servant to Wolsey.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">GRIFFITH, Gentleman-usher to Queen Katharine.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Three Gentlemen.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DOCTOR BUTTS, Physician to the King.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Garter King-at-Arms. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Surveyor to the Duke of Buckingham. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BRANDON</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Sergeant-at-Arms. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Door-keeper of the Council-chamber. Porter, and his Man. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Page to Gardiner. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Crier. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">QUEEN KATHARINE Wife to King Henry, afterwards</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">divorced. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ANNE BULLEN,  her Maid of Honour, afterwards Queen. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">An old Lady, friend to Anne Bullen. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PATIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Several Lords and Ladies in the Dumb Shows; Women attending upon the Queen; Scribes, Officers, Guards, and other Attendants.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Spirits.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  London; Westminster; Kimbolton</p>
         </article>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>THE PROLOGUE</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="dialogue">
               <div class="linegroup">
                  <div class="speaker"/>
                  <div class="line">I come no more to make you laugh: things now,</div>
                  <div class="line">That bear a weighty and a serious brow,</div>
                  <div class="line">Sad, high, and working, full of state and woe,</div>
                  <div class="line">Such noble scenes as draw the eye to flow,</div>
                  <div class="line">We now present. Those that can pity, here</div>
                  <div class="line">May, if they think it well, let fall a tear;</div>
                  <div class="line">The subject will deserve it. Such as give</div>
                  <div class="line">Their money out of hope they may believe,</div>
                  <div class="line">May here find truth too. Those that come to see</div>
                  <div class="line">Only a show or two, and so agree</div>
                  <div class="line">The play may pass, if they be still and willing,</div>
                  <div class="line">I'll undertake may see away their shilling</div>
                  <div class="line">Richly in two short hours. Only they</div>
                  <div class="line">That come to hear a merry bawdy play,</div>
                  <div class="line">A noise of targets, or to see a fellow</div>
                  <div class="line">In a long motley coat guarded with yellow,</div>
                  <div class="line">Will be deceived; for, gentle hearers, know,</div>
                  <div class="line">To rank our chosen truth with such a show</div>
                  <div class="line">As fool and fight is, beside forfeiting</div>
                  <div class="line">Our own brains, and the opinion that we bring,</div>
                  <div class="line">To make that only true we now intend,</div>
                  <div class="line">Will leave us never an understanding friend.</div>
                  <div class="line">Therefore, for goodness' sake, and as you are known</div>
                  <div class="line">The first and happiest hearers of the town,</div>
                  <div class="line">Be sad, as we would make ye: think ye see</div>
                  <div class="line">The very persons of our noble story</div>
                  <div class="line">As they were living; think you see them great,</div>
                  <div class="line">And follow'd with the general throng and sweat</div>
                  <div class="line">Of thousand friends; then in a moment, see</div>
                  <div class="line">How soon this mightiness meets misery:</div>
                  <div class="line">And, if you can be merry then, I'll say</div>
                  <div class="line">A man may weep upon his wedding-day.</div>
               </div>
            </div>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. The council-chamber.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  A Hall in York Place.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter NORFOLK at one door; at the other, BUCKINGHAM
and ABERGAVENNY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done</div>
                     <div class="line">Since last we saw in France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Healthful; and ever since a fresh admirer</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what I saw there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">An untimely ague</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay'd me a prisoner in my chamber when</div>
                     <div class="line">Those suns of glory, those two lights of men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Met in the vale of Andren.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twixt Guynes and Arde:</div>
                     <div class="line">I was then present, saw them salute on horseback;</div>
                     <div class="line">Beheld them, when they lighted, how they clung</div>
                     <div class="line">In their embracement, as they grew together;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which had they, what four throned ones could have weigh'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Such a compounded one?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">All the whole time</div>
                     <div class="line">I was my chamber's prisoner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you lost</div>
                     <div class="line">The view of earthly glory: men might say,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till this time pomp was single, but now married</div>
                     <div class="line">To one above itself. Each following day</div>
                     <div class="line">Became the next day's master, till the last</div>
                     <div class="line">Made former wonders its. To-day the French,</div>
                     <div class="line">All clinquant, all in gold, like heathen gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shone down the English; and, to-morrow, they</div>
                     <div class="line">Made Britain India: every man that stood</div>
                     <div class="line">Show'd like a mine. Their dwarfish pages were</div>
                     <div class="line">As cherubins, all guilt: the madams too,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not used to toil, did almost sweat to bear</div>
                     <div class="line">The pride upon them, that their very labour</div>
                     <div class="line">Was to them as a painting: now this masque</div>
                     <div class="line">Was cried incomparable; and the ensuing night</div>
                     <div class="line">Made it a fool and beggar. The two kings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Equal in lustre, were now best, now worst,</div>
                     <div class="line">As presence did present them; him in eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still him in praise: and, being present both</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas said they saw but one; and no discerner</div>
                     <div class="line">Durst wag his tongue in censure. When these suns--</div>
                     <div class="line">For so they phrase 'em--by their heralds challenged</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble spirits to arms, they did perform</div>
                     <div class="line">Beyond thought's compass; that former fabulous story,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being now seen possible enough, got credit,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Bevis was believed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">O, you go far.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">As I belong to worship and affect</div>
                     <div class="line">In honour honesty, the tract of every thing</div>
                     <div class="line">Would by a good discourser lose some life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which action's self was tongue to. All was royal;</div>
                     <div class="line">To the disposing of it nought rebell'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Order gave each thing view; the office did</div>
                     <div class="line">Distinctly his full function.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Who did guide,</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, who set the body and the limbs</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this great sport together, as you guess?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">One, certes, that promises no element</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, who, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">All this was order'd by the good discretion</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the right reverend Cardinal of York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">The devil speed him! no man's pie is freed</div>
                     <div class="line">From his ambitious finger. What had he</div>
                     <div class="line">To do in these fierce vanities? I wonder</div>
                     <div class="line">That such a keech can with his very bulk</div>
                     <div class="line">Take up the rays o' the beneficial sun</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep it from the earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Surely, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">There's in him stuff that puts him to these ends;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, being not propp'd by ancestry, whose grace</div>
                     <div class="line">Chalks successors their way, nor call'd upon</div>
                     <div class="line">For high feats done to the crown; neither allied</div>
                     <div class="line">For eminent assistants; but, spider-like,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of his self-drawing web, he gives us note,</div>
                     <div class="line">The force of his own merit makes his way</div>
                     <div class="line">A gift that heaven gives for him, which buys</div>
                     <div class="line">A place next to the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot tell</div>
                     <div class="line">What heaven hath given him,--let some graver eye</div>
                     <div class="line">Pierce into that; but I can see his pride</div>
                     <div class="line">Peep through each part of him: whence has he that,</div>
                     <div class="line">If not from hell? the devil is a niggard,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or has given all before, and he begins</div>
                     <div class="line">A new hell in himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why the devil,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this French going out, took he upon him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the privity o' the king, to appoint</div>
                     <div class="line">Who should attend on him? He makes up the file</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all the gentry; for the most part such</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom as great a charge as little honour</div>
                     <div class="line">He meant to lay upon: and his own letter,</div>
                     <div class="line">The honourable board of council out,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must fetch him in the papers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                     <div class="line">I do know</div>
                     <div class="line">Kinsmen of mine, three at the least, that have</div>
                     <div class="line">By this so sickened their estates, that never</div>
                     <div class="line">They shall abound as formerly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">O, many</div>
                     <div class="line">Have broke their backs with laying manors on 'em</div>
                     <div class="line">For this great journey. What did this vanity</div>
                     <div class="line">But minister communication of</div>
                     <div class="line">A most poor issue?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Grievingly I think,</div>
                     <div class="line">The peace between the French and us not values</div>
                     <div class="line">The cost that did conclude it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Every man,</div>
                     <div class="line">After the hideous storm that follow'd, was</div>
                     <div class="line">A thing inspired; and, not consulting, broke</div>
                     <div class="line">Into a general prophecy; That this tempest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dashing the garment of this peace, aboded</div>
                     <div class="line">The sudden breach on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is budded out;</div>
                     <div class="line">For France hath flaw'd the league, and hath attach'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Our merchants' goods at Bourdeaux.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">The ambassador is silenced?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, is't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                     <div class="line">A proper title of a peace; and purchased</div>
                     <div class="line">At a superfluous rate!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, all this business</div>
                     <div class="line">Our reverend cardinal carried.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Like it your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">The state takes notice of the private difference</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt you and the cardinal. I advise you--</div>
                     <div class="line">And take it from a heart that wishes towards you</div>
                     <div class="line">Honour and plenteous safety--that you read</div>
                     <div class="line">The cardinal's malice and his potency</div>
                     <div class="line">Together; to consider further that</div>
                     <div class="line">What his high hatred would effect wants not</div>
                     <div class="line">A minister in his power. You know his nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he's revengeful, and I know his sword</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath a sharp edge: it's long and, 't may be said,</div>
                     <div class="line">It reaches far, and where 'twill not extend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thither he darts it. Bosom up my counsel,</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll find it wholesome. Lo, where comes that rock</div>
                     <div class="line">That I advise your shunning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY, the purse borne before him,
certain of the Guard, and two Secretaries with
papers. CARDINAL WOLSEY in his passage fixeth his
eye on BUCKINGHAM, and BUCKINGHAM on him, both full
of disdain</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor, ha?</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's his examination?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Secretary</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, so please you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he in person ready?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Secretary</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, please your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, we shall then know more; and Buckingham</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall lessen this big look.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CARDINAL WOLSEY and his Train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">This butcher's cur is venom-mouth'd, and I</div>
                     <div class="line">Have not the power to muzzle him; therefore best</div>
                     <div class="line">Not wake him in his slumber. A beggar's book</div>
                     <div class="line">Outworths a noble's blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">What, are you chafed?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ask God for temperance; that's the appliance only</div>
                     <div class="line">Which your disease requires.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I read in's looks</div>
                     <div class="line">Matter against me; and his eye reviled</div>
                     <div class="line">Me, as his abject object: at this instant</div>
                     <div class="line">He bores me with some trick: he's gone to the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll follow and outstare him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let your reason with your choler question</div>
                     <div class="line">What 'tis you go about: to climb steep hills</div>
                     <div class="line">Requires slow pace at first: anger is like</div>
                     <div class="line">A full-hot horse, who being allow'd his way,</div>
                     <div class="line">Self-mettle tires him. Not a man in England</div>
                     <div class="line">Can advise me like you: be to yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">As you would to your friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll to the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">And from a mouth of honour quite cry down</div>
                     <div class="line">This Ipswich fellow's insolence; or proclaim</div>
                     <div class="line">There's difference in no persons.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Be advised;</div>
                     <div class="line">Heat not a furnace for your foe so hot</div>
                     <div class="line">That it do singe yourself: we may outrun,</div>
                     <div class="line">By violent swiftness, that which we run at,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lose by over-running. Know you not,</div>
                     <div class="line">The fire that mounts the liquor til run o'er,</div>
                     <div class="line">In seeming to augment it wastes it? Be advised:</div>
                     <div class="line">I say again, there is no English soul</div>
                     <div class="line">More stronger to direct you than yourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">If with the sap of reason you would quench,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or but allay, the fire of passion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thankful to you; and I'll go along</div>
                     <div class="line">By your prescription: but this top-proud fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom from the flow of gall I name not but</div>
                     <div class="line">From sincere motions, by intelligence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And proofs as clear as founts in July when</div>
                     <div class="line">We see each grain of gravel, I do know</div>
                     <div class="line">To be corrupt and treasonous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Say not 'treasonous.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">To the king I'll say't; and make my vouch as strong</div>
                     <div class="line">As shore of rock. Attend. This holy fox,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or wolf, or both,--for he is equal ravenous</div>
                     <div class="line">As he is subtle, and as prone to mischief</div>
                     <div class="line">As able to perform't; his mind and place</div>
                     <div class="line">Infecting one another, yea, reciprocally--</div>
                     <div class="line">Only to show his pomp as well in France</div>
                     <div class="line">As here at home, suggests the king our master</div>
                     <div class="line">To this last costly treaty, the interview,</div>
                     <div class="line">That swallow'd so much treasure, and like a glass</div>
                     <div class="line">Did break i' the rinsing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, and so it did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, give me favour, sir. This cunning cardinal</div>
                     <div class="line">The articles o' the combination drew</div>
                     <div class="line">As himself pleased; and they were ratified</div>
                     <div class="line">As he cried 'Thus let be': to as much end</div>
                     <div class="line">As give a crutch to the dead: but our count-cardinal</div>
                     <div class="line">Has done this, and 'tis well; for worthy Wolsey,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who cannot err, he did it. Now this follows,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, as I take it, is a kind of puppy</div>
                     <div class="line">To the old dam, treason,--Charles the emperor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under pretence to see the queen his aunt--</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'twas indeed his colour, but he came</div>
                     <div class="line">To whisper Wolsey,--here makes visitation:</div>
                     <div class="line">His fears were, that the interview betwixt</div>
                     <div class="line">England and France might, through their amity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Breed him some prejudice; for from this league</div>
                     <div class="line">Peep'd harms that menaced him: he privily</div>
                     <div class="line">Deals with our cardinal; and, as I trow,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I do well; for I am sure the emperor</div>
                     <div class="line">Paid ere he promised; whereby his suit was granted</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere it was ask'd; but when the way was made,</div>
                     <div class="line">And paved with gold, the emperor thus desired,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he would please to alter the king's course,</div>
                     <div class="line">And break the foresaid peace. Let the king know,</div>
                     <div class="line">As soon he shall by me, that thus the cardinal</div>
                     <div class="line">Does buy and sell his honour as he pleases,</div>
                     <div class="line">And for his own advantage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear this of him; and could wish he were</div>
                     <div class="line">Something mistaken in't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not a syllable:</div>
                     <div class="line">I  do pronounce him in that very shape</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall appear in proof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BRANDON, a Sergeant-at-arms before him, and
two or three of the Guard</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                     <div class="line">Your office, sergeant; execute it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Sergeant</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord the Duke of Buckingham, and Earl</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Hereford, Stafford, and Northampton, I</div>
                     <div class="line">Arrest thee of high treason, in the name</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our most sovereign king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, you, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">The net has fall'n upon me! I shall perish</div>
                     <div class="line">Under device and practise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry</div>
                     <div class="line">To see you ta'en from liberty, to look on</div>
                     <div class="line">The business present: 'tis his highness' pleasure</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall to the Tower.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">It will help me nothing</div>
                     <div class="line">To plead mine innocence; for that dye is on me</div>
                     <div class="line">Which makes my whitest part black. The will of heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Be done in this and all things! I obey.</div>
                     <div class="line">O my Lord Abergavenny, fare you well!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, he must bear you company. The king</div>
                     <p>To ABERGAVENNY</p>
                     <div class="line">Is pleased you shall to the Tower, till you know</div>
                     <div class="line">How he determines further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                     <div class="line">As the duke said,</div>
                     <div class="line">The will of heaven be done, and the king's pleasure</div>
                     <div class="line">By me obey'd!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is a warrant from</div>
                     <div class="line">The king to attach Lord Montacute; and the bodies</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the duke's confessor, John de la Car,</div>
                     <div class="line">One Gilbert Peck, his chancellor--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">So, so;</div>
                     <div class="line">These are the limbs o' the plot: no more, I hope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                     <div class="line">A monk o' the Chartreux.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">O, Nicholas Hopkins?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                     <div class="line">He.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My surveyor is false; the o'er-great cardinal</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath show'd him gold; my life is spann'd already:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am the shadow of poor Buckingham,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose figure even this instant cloud puts on,</div>
                     <div class="line">By darkening my clear sun. My lord, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. The council-chamber.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Cornets. Enter KING HENRY VIII, leaning on
CARDINAL WOLSEY's shoulder, the Nobles, and LOVELL;
CARDINAL WOLSEY places himself under KING HENRY
VIII's feet on his right side</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">My life itself, and the best heart of it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thanks you for this great care: I stood i' the level</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a full-charged confederacy, and give thanks</div>
                     <div class="line">To you that choked it. Let be call'd before us</div>
                     <div class="line">That gentleman of Buckingham's; in person</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll hear him his confessions justify;</div>
                     <div class="line">And point by point the treasons of his master</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall again relate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A noise within, crying 'Room for the Queen!' Enter
QUEEN KATHARINE, ushered by NORFOLK, and SUFFOLK:
she kneels. KING HENRY VIII riseth from his state,
takes her up, kisses and placeth her by him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, we must longer kneel: I am a suitor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Arise, and take place by us: half your suit</div>
                     <div class="line">Never name to us; you have half our power:</div>
                     <div class="line">The other moiety, ere you ask, is given;</div>
                     <div class="line">Repeat your will and take it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thank your majesty.</div>
                     <div class="line">That you would love yourself, and in that love</div>
                     <div class="line">Not unconsider'd leave your honour, nor</div>
                     <div class="line">The dignity of your office, is the point</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my petition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady mine, proceed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am solicited, not by a few,</div>
                     <div class="line">And those of true condition, that your subjects</div>
                     <div class="line">Are in great grievance: there have been commissions</div>
                     <div class="line">Sent down among 'em, which hath flaw'd the heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all their loyalties: wherein, although,</div>
                     <div class="line">My good lord cardinal, they vent reproaches</div>
                     <div class="line">Most bitterly on you, as putter on</div>
                     <div class="line">Of these exactions, yet the king our master--</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose honour heaven shield from soil!--even he</div>
                     <div class="line">escapes not</div>
                     <div class="line">Language unmannerly, yea, such which breaks</div>
                     <div class="line">The sides of loyalty, and almost appears</div>
                     <div class="line">In loud rebellion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Not almost appears,</div>
                     <div class="line">It doth appear; for, upon these taxations,</div>
                     <div class="line">The clothiers all, not able to maintain</div>
                     <div class="line">The many to them longing, have put off</div>
                     <div class="line">The spinsters, carders, fullers, weavers, who,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unfit for other life, compell'd by hunger</div>
                     <div class="line">And lack of other means, in desperate manner</div>
                     <div class="line">Daring the event to the teeth, are all in uproar,</div>
                     <div class="line">And danger serves among then!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Taxation!</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein? and what taxation? My lord cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">You that are blamed for it alike with us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Know you of this taxation?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Please you, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">I know but of a single part, in aught</div>
                     <div class="line">Pertains to the state; and front but in that file</div>
                     <div class="line">Where others tell steps with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">You know no more than others; but you frame</div>
                     <div class="line">Things that are known alike; which are not wholesome</div>
                     <div class="line">To those which would not know them, and yet must</div>
                     <div class="line">Perforce be their acquaintance. These exactions,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof my sovereign would have note, they are</div>
                     <div class="line">Most pestilent to the bearing; and, to bear 'em,</div>
                     <div class="line">The back is sacrifice to the load. They say</div>
                     <div class="line">They are devised by you; or else you suffer</div>
                     <div class="line">Too hard an exclamation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Still exaction!</div>
                     <div class="line">The nature of it? in what kind, let's know,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this exaction?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am much too venturous</div>
                     <div class="line">In tempting of your patience; but am bolden'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Under your promised pardon. The subjects' grief</div>
                     <div class="line">Comes through commissions, which compel from each</div>
                     <div class="line">The sixth part of his substance, to be levied</div>
                     <div class="line">Without delay; and the pretence for this</div>
                     <div class="line">Is named, your wars in France: this makes bold mouths:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tongues spit their duties out, and cold hearts freeze</div>
                     <div class="line">Allegiance in them; their curses now</div>
                     <div class="line">Live where their prayers did: and it's come to pass,</div>
                     <div class="line">This tractable obedience is a slave</div>
                     <div class="line">To each incensed will. I would your highness</div>
                     <div class="line">Would give it quick consideration, for</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no primer business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">By my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">This is against our pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">And for me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have no further gone in this than by</div>
                     <div class="line">A single voice; and that not pass'd me but</div>
                     <div class="line">By learned approbation of the judges. If I am</div>
                     <div class="line">Traduced by ignorant tongues, which neither know</div>
                     <div class="line">My faculties nor person, yet will be</div>
                     <div class="line">The chronicles of my doing, let me say</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but the fate of place, and the rough brake</div>
                     <div class="line">That virtue must go through. We must not stint</div>
                     <div class="line">Our necessary actions, in the fear</div>
                     <div class="line">To cope malicious censurers; which ever,</div>
                     <div class="line">As ravenous fishes, do a vessel follow</div>
                     <div class="line">That is new-trimm'd, but benefit no further</div>
                     <div class="line">Than vainly longing. What we oft do best,</div>
                     <div class="line">By sick interpreters, once weak ones, is</div>
                     <div class="line">Not ours, or not allow'd; what worst, as oft,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hitting a grosser quality, is cried up</div>
                     <div class="line">For our best act. If we shall stand still,</div>
                     <div class="line">In fear our motion will be mock'd or carp'd at,</div>
                     <div class="line">We should take root here where we sit, or sit</div>
                     <div class="line">State-statues only.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Things done well,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a care, exempt themselves from fear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Things done without example, in their issue</div>
                     <div class="line">Are to be fear'd. Have you a precedent</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this commission? I believe, not any.</div>
                     <div class="line">We must not rend our subjects from our laws,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stick them in our will. Sixth part of each?</div>
                     <div class="line">A trembling contribution! Why, we take</div>
                     <div class="line">From every tree lop, bark, and part o' the timber;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, though we leave it with a root, thus hack'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">The air will drink the sap. To every county</div>
                     <div class="line">Where this is question'd send our letters, with</div>
                     <div class="line">Free pardon to each man that has denied</div>
                     <div class="line">The force of this commission: pray, look to't;</div>
                     <div class="line">I put it to your care.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">A word with you.</div>
                     <p>To the Secretary</p>
                     <div class="line">Let there be letters writ to every shire,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the king's grace and pardon. The grieved commons</div>
                     <div class="line">Hardly conceive of me; let it be noised</div>
                     <div class="line">That through our intercession this revokement</div>
                     <div class="line">And pardon comes: I shall anon advise you</div>
                     <div class="line">Further in the proceeding.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Secretary</p>
               <p>Enter Surveyor</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry that the Duke of Buckingham</div>
                     <div class="line">Is run in your displeasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">It grieves many:</div>
                     <div class="line">The gentleman is learn'd, and a most rare speaker;</div>
                     <div class="line">To nature none more bound; his training such,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he may furnish and instruct great teachers,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never seek for aid out of himself. Yet see,</div>
                     <div class="line">When these so noble benefits shall prove</div>
                     <div class="line">Not well disposed, the mind growing once corrupt,</div>
                     <div class="line">They turn to vicious forms, ten times more ugly</div>
                     <div class="line">Than ever they were fair. This man so complete,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who was enroll'd 'mongst wonders, and when we,</div>
                     <div class="line">Almost with ravish'd listening, could not find</div>
                     <div class="line">His hour of speech a minute; he, my lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath into monstrous habits put the graces</div>
                     <div class="line">That once were his, and is become as black</div>
                     <div class="line">As if besmear'd in hell. Sit by us; you shall hear--</div>
                     <div class="line">This was his gentleman in trust--of him</div>
                     <div class="line">Things to strike honour sad. Bid him recount</div>
                     <div class="line">The fore-recited practises; whereof</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot feel too little, hear too much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand forth, and with bold spirit relate what you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most like a careful subject, have collected</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the Duke of Buckingham.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak freely.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">First, it was usual with him, every day</div>
                     <div class="line">It would infect his speech, that if the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Should without issue die, he'll carry it so</div>
                     <div class="line">To make the sceptre his: these very words</div>
                     <div class="line">I've heard him utter to his son-in-law,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Abergavenny; to whom by oath he menaced</div>
                     <div class="line">Revenge upon the cardinal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Please your highness, note</div>
                     <div class="line">This dangerous conception in this point.</div>
                     <div class="line">Not friended by by his wish, to your high person</div>
                     <div class="line">His will is most malignant; and it stretches</div>
                     <div class="line">Beyond you, to your friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">My learn'd lord cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver all with charity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak on:</div>
                     <div class="line">How grounded he his title to the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon our fail? to this point hast thou heard him</div>
                     <div class="line">At any time speak aught?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">He was brought to this</div>
                     <div class="line">By a vain prophecy of Nicholas Hopkins.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">What was that Hopkins?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, a Chartreux friar,</div>
                     <div class="line">His confessor, who fed him every minute</div>
                     <div class="line">With words of sovereignty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">How know'st thou this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">Not long before your highness sped to France,</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke being at the Rose, within the parish</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint Lawrence Poultney, did of me demand</div>
                     <div class="line">What was the speech among the Londoners</div>
                     <div class="line">Concerning the French journey: I replied,</div>
                     <div class="line">Men fear'd the French would prove perfidious,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the king's danger. Presently the duke</div>
                     <div class="line">Said, 'twas the fear, indeed; and that he doubted</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twould prove the verity of certain words</div>
                     <div class="line">Spoke by a holy monk; 'that oft,' says he,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Hath sent to me, wishing me to permit</div>
                     <div class="line">John de la Car, my chaplain, a choice hour</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear from him a matter of some moment:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom after under the confession's seal</div>
                     <div class="line">He solemnly had sworn, that what he spoke</div>
                     <div class="line">My chaplain to no creature living, but</div>
                     <div class="line">To me, should utter, with demure confidence</div>
                     <div class="line">This pausingly ensued: neither the king nor's heirs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell you the duke, shall prosper: bid him strive</div>
                     <div class="line">To gain the love o' the commonalty: the duke</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall govern England.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">If I know you well,</div>
                     <div class="line">You were the duke's surveyor, and lost your office</div>
                     <div class="line">On the complaint o' the tenants: take good heed</div>
                     <div class="line">You charge not in your spleen a noble person</div>
                     <div class="line">And spoil your nobler soul: I say, take heed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, heartily beseech you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him on.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go forward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">On my soul, I'll speak but truth.</div>
                     <div class="line">I told my lord the duke, by the devil's illusions</div>
                     <div class="line">The monk might be deceived; and that 'twas dangerous for him</div>
                     <div class="line">To ruminate on this so far, until</div>
                     <div class="line">It forged him some design, which, being believed,</div>
                     <div class="line">It was much like to do: he answer'd, 'Tush,</div>
                     <div class="line">It can do me no damage;' adding further,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, had the king in his last sickness fail'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">The cardinal's and Sir Thomas Lovell's heads</div>
                     <div class="line">Should have gone off.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! what, so rank? Ah ha!</div>
                     <div class="line">There's mischief in this man: canst thou say further?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">I can, my liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">Being at Greenwich,</div>
                     <div class="line">After your highness had reproved the duke</div>
                     <div class="line">About Sir William Blomer,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">I remember</div>
                     <div class="line">Of such a time: being my sworn servant,</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke retain'd him his. But on; what hence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">'If,' quoth he, 'I for this had been committed,</div>
                     <div class="line">As, to the Tower, I thought, I would have play'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The part my father meant to act upon</div>
                     <div class="line">The usurper Richard; who, being at Salisbury,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made suit to come in's presence; which if granted,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he made semblance of his duty, would</div>
                     <div class="line">Have put his knife to him.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">A giant traitor!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, madam, may his highness live in freedom,</div>
                     <div class="line">and this man out of prison?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">God mend all!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">There's something more would out of thee; what say'st?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Surveyor</div>
                     <div class="line">After 'the duke his father,' with 'the knife,'</div>
                     <div class="line">He stretch'd him, and, with one hand on his dagger,</div>
                     <div class="line">Another spread on's breast, mounting his eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">He did discharge a horrible oath; whose tenor</div>
                     <div class="line">Was,--were he evil used, he would outgo</div>
                     <div class="line">His father by as much as a performance</div>
                     <div class="line">Does an irresolute purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">There's his period,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sheathe his knife in us. He is attach'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">Call him to present trial: if he may</div>
                     <div class="line">Find mercy in the law, 'tis his: if none,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him not seek 't of us: by day and night,</div>
                     <div class="line">He's traitor to the height.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  An ante-chamber in the palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Chamberlain and SANDS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't possible the spells of France should juggle</div>
                     <div class="line">Men into such strange mysteries?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SANDS</div>
                     <div class="line">New customs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though they be never so ridiculous,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let 'em be unmanly, yet are follow'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">As far as I see, all the good our English</div>
                     <div class="line">Have got by the late voyage is but merely</div>
                     <div class="line">A fit or two o' the face; but they are shrewd ones;</div>
                     <div class="line">For when they hold 'em, you would swear directly</div>
                     <div class="line">Their very noses had been counsellors</div>
                     <div class="line">To Pepin or Clotharius, they keep state so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SANDS</div>
                     <div class="line">They have all new legs, and lame ones: one would take it,</div>
                     <div class="line">That never saw 'em pace before, the spavin</div>
                     <div class="line">Or springhalt reign'd among 'em.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">Death! my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their clothes are after such a pagan cut too,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, sure, they've worn out Christendom.</div>
                     <p>Enter LOVELL</p>
                     <div class="line">How now!</div>
                     <div class="line">What news, Sir Thomas Lovell?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LOVELL</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hear of none, but the new proclamation</div>
                     <div class="line">That's clapp'd upon the court-gate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">What is't for?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LOVELL</div>
                     <div class="line">The reformation of our travell'd gallants,</div>
                     <div class="line">That fill the court with quarrels, talk, and tailors.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">I'm glad 'tis there: now I would pray our monsieurs</div>
                     <div class="line">To think an English courtier may be wise,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never see the Louvre.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LOVELL</div>
                     <div class="line">They must either,</div>
                     <div class="line">For so run the conditions, leave those remnants</div>
                     <div class="line">Of fool and feather that they got in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all their honourable point of ignorance</div>
                     <div class="line">Pertaining thereunto, as fights and fireworks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Abusing better men than they can be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of a foreign wisdom, renouncing clean</div>
                     <div class="line">The faith they have in tennis, and tall stockings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Short blister'd breeches, and those types of travel,</div>
                     <div class="line">And understand again like honest men;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or pack to their old playfellows: there, I take it,</div>
                     <div class="line">They may, 'cum privilegio,' wear away</div>
                     <div class="line">The lag end of their lewdness and be laugh'd at.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SANDS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis time to give 'em physic, their diseases</div>
                     <div class="line">Are grown so catching.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">What a loss our ladies</div>
                     <div class="line">Will have of these trim vanities!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LOVELL</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry,</div>
                     <div class="line">There will be woe indeed, lords: the sly whoresons</div>
                     <div class="line">Have got a speeding trick to lay down ladies;</div>
                     <div class="line">A French song and a fiddle has no fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SANDS</div>
                     <div class="line">The devil fiddle 'em! I am glad they are going,</div>
                     <div class="line">For, sure, there's no converting of 'em: now</div>
                     <div class="line">An honest country lord, as I am, beaten</div>
                     <div class="line">A long time out of play, may bring his plainsong</div>
                     <div class="line">And have an hour of hearing; and, by'r lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">Held current music too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, Lord Sands;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your colt's tooth is not cast yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
