                     <div class="line">He has; and we shall see him</div>
                     <div class="line">For it an archbishop.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">So I hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis so.</div>
                     <div class="line">The cardinal!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY and CROMWELL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Observe, observe, he's moody.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">The packet, Cromwell.</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave't you the king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">To his own hand, in's bedchamber.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Look'd he o' the inside of the paper?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">Presently</div>
                     <div class="line">He did unseal them: and the first he view'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">He did it with a serious mind; a heed</div>
                     <div class="line">Was in his countenance. You he bade</div>
                     <div class="line">Attend him here this morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Is he ready</div>
                     <div class="line">To come abroad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">I think, by this he is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave me awhile.</div>
                     <p>Exit CROMWELL</p>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">It shall be to the Duchess of Alencon,</div>
                     <div class="line">The French king's sister: he shall marry her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Anne Bullen! No; I'll no Anne Bullens for him:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's more in't than fair visage. Bullen!</div>
                     <div class="line">No, we'll no Bullens. Speedily I wish</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear from Rome. The Marchioness of Pembroke!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">He's discontented.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">May be, he hears the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Does whet his anger to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Sharp enough,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, for thy justice!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  The late queen's gentlewoman,</div>
                     <div class="line">a knight's daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be her mistress' mistress! the queen's queen!</div>
                     <div class="line">This candle burns not clear: 'tis I must snuff it;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then out it goes. What though I know her virtuous</div>
                     <div class="line">And well deserving? yet I know her for</div>
                     <div class="line">A spleeny Lutheran; and not wholesome to</div>
                     <div class="line">Our cause, that she should lie i' the bosom of</div>
                     <div class="line">Our hard-ruled king. Again, there is sprung up</div>
                     <div class="line">An heretic, an arch one, Cranmer; one</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath crawl'd into the favour of the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And is his oracle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">He is vex'd at something.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">I would 'twere something that would fret the string,</div>
                     <div class="line">The master-cord on's heart!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING HENRY VIII, reading of a schedule, and LOVELL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">The king, the king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">What piles of wealth hath he accumulated</div>
                     <div class="line">To his own portion! and what expense by the hour</div>
                     <div class="line">Seems to flow from him! How, i' the name of thrift,</div>
                     <div class="line">Does he rake this together! Now, my lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Saw you the cardinal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, we have</div>
                     <div class="line">Stood here observing him: some strange commotion</div>
                     <div class="line">Is in his brain: he bites his lip, and starts;</div>
                     <div class="line">Stops on a sudden, looks upon the ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then lays his finger on his temple, straight</div>
                     <div class="line">Springs out into fast gait; then stops again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Strikes his breast hard, and anon he casts</div>
                     <div class="line">His eye against the moon: in most strange postures</div>
                     <div class="line">We have seen him set himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">It may well be;</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a mutiny in's mind. This morning</div>
                     <div class="line">Papers of state he sent me to peruse,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I required: and wot you what I found</div>
                     <div class="line">There,--on my conscience, put unwittingly?</div>
                     <div class="line">Forsooth, an inventory, thus importing;</div>
                     <div class="line">The several parcels of his plate, his treasure,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rich stuffs, and ornaments of household; which</div>
                     <div class="line">I find at such proud rate, that it out-speaks</div>
                     <div class="line">Possession of a subject.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">It's heaven's will:</div>
                     <div class="line">Some spirit put this paper in the packet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bless your eye withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">If we did think</div>
                     <div class="line">His contemplation were above the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fix'd on spiritual object, he should still</div>
                     <div class="line">Dwell in his musings: but I am afraid</div>
                     <div class="line">His thinkings are below the moon, not worth</div>
                     <div class="line">His serious considering.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>King HENRY VIII takes his seat; whispers LOVELL,
who goes to CARDINAL WOLSEY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven forgive me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever God bless your highness!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are full of heavenly stuff, and bear the inventory</div>
                     <div class="line">Of your best graces in your mind; the which</div>
                     <div class="line">You were now running o'er: you have scarce time</div>
                     <div class="line">To steal from spiritual leisure a brief span</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep your earthly audit: sure, in that</div>
                     <div class="line">I deem you an ill husband, and am glad</div>
                     <div class="line">To have you therein my companion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">For holy offices I have a time; a time</div>
                     <div class="line">To think upon the part of business which</div>
                     <div class="line">I bear i' the state; and nature does require</div>
                     <div class="line">Her times of preservation, which perforce</div>
                     <div class="line">I, her frail son, amongst my brethren mortal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must give my tendence to.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">You have said well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">And ever may your highness yoke together,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I will lend you cause, my doing well</div>
                     <div class="line">With my well saying!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis well said again;</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'tis a kind of good deed to say well:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet words are no deeds. My father loved you:</div>
                     <div class="line">His said he did; and with his deed did crown</div>
                     <div class="line">His word upon you. Since I had my office,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have kept you next my heart; have not alone</div>
                     <div class="line">Employ'd you where high profits might come home,</div>
                     <div class="line">But pared my present havings, to bestow</div>
                     <div class="line">My bounties upon you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>             What should this mean?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  The Lord increase this business!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I not made you,</div>
                     <div class="line">The prime man of the state? I pray you, tell me,</div>
                     <div class="line">If what I now pronounce you have found true:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, if you may confess it, say withal,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you are bound to us or no. What say you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">My sovereign, I confess your royal graces,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shower'd on me daily, have been more than could</div>
                     <div class="line">My studied purposes requite; which went</div>
                     <div class="line">Beyond all man's endeavours: my endeavours</div>
                     <div class="line">Have ever come too short of my desires,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet filed with my abilities: mine own ends</div>
                     <div class="line">Have been mine so that evermore they pointed</div>
                     <div class="line">To the good of your most sacred person and</div>
                     <div class="line">The profit of the state. For your great graces</div>
                     <div class="line">Heap'd upon me, poor undeserver, I</div>
                     <div class="line">Can nothing render but allegiant thanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">My prayers to heaven for you, my loyalty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which ever has and ever shall be growing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till death, that winter, kill it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Fairly answer'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">A loyal and obedient subject is</div>
                     <div class="line">Therein illustrated: the honour of it</div>
                     <div class="line">Does pay the act of it; as, i' the contrary,</div>
                     <div class="line">The foulness is the punishment. I presume</div>
                     <div class="line">That, as my hand has open'd bounty to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">My heart dropp'd love, my power rain'd honour, more</div>
                     <div class="line">On you than any; so your hand and heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your brain, and every function of your power,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should, notwithstanding that your bond of duty,</div>
                     <div class="line">As 'twere in love's particular, be more</div>
                     <div class="line">To me, your friend, than any.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">I do profess</div>
                     <div class="line">That for your highness' good I ever labour'd</div>
                     <div class="line">More than mine own; that am, have, and will be--</div>
                     <div class="line">Though all the world should crack their duty to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">And throw it from their soul; though perils did</div>
                     <div class="line">Abound, as thick as thought could make 'em, and</div>
                     <div class="line">Appear in forms more horrid,--yet my duty,</div>
                     <div class="line">As doth a rock against the chiding flood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should the approach of this wild river break,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stand unshaken yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis nobly spoken:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take notice, lords, he has a loyal breast,</div>
                     <div class="line">For you have seen him open't. Read o'er this;</div>
                     <p>Giving him papers</p>
                     <div class="line">And after, this: and then to breakfast with</div>
                     <div class="line">What appetite you have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit KING HENRY VIII, frowning upon CARDINAL WOLSEY:
the Nobles throng after him, smiling and whispering</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">What should this mean?</div>
                     <div class="line">What sudden anger's this? how have I reap'd it?</div>
                     <div class="line">He parted frowning from me, as if ruin</div>
                     <div class="line">Leap'd from his eyes: so looks the chafed lion</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the daring huntsman that has gall'd him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then makes him nothing. I must read this paper;</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear, the story of his anger. 'Tis so;</div>
                     <div class="line">This paper has undone me: 'tis the account</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all that world of wealth I have drawn together</div>
                     <div class="line">For mine own ends; indeed, to gain the popedom,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fee my friends in Rome. O negligence!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fit for a fool to fall by: what cross devil</div>
                     <div class="line">Made me put this main secret in the packet</div>
                     <div class="line">I sent the king? Is there no way to cure this?</div>
                     <div class="line">No new device to beat this from his brains?</div>
                     <div class="line">I know 'twill stir him strongly; yet I know</div>
                     <div class="line">A way, if it take right, in spite of fortune</div>
                     <div class="line">Will bring me off again. What's this? 'To the Pope!'</div>
                     <div class="line">The letter, as I live, with all the business</div>
                     <div class="line">I writ to's holiness. Nay then, farewell!</div>
                     <div class="line">I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, from that full meridian of my glory,</div>
                     <div class="line">I haste now to my setting: I shall fall</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a bright exhalation m the evening,</div>
                     <div class="line">And no man see me more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter to CARDINAL WOLSEY, NORFOLK and SUFFOLK, SURREY,
and the Chamberlain</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear the king's pleasure, cardinal: who commands you</div>
                     <div class="line">To render up the great seal presently</div>
                     <div class="line">Into our hands; and to confine yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">To Asher House, my Lord of Winchester's,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till you hear further from his highness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's your commission, lords? words cannot carry</div>
                     <div class="line">Authority so weighty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Who dare cross 'em,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bearing the king's will from his mouth expressly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Till I find more than will or words to do it,</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean your malice, know, officious lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare and must deny it. Now I feel</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what coarse metal ye are moulded, envy:</div>
                     <div class="line">How eagerly ye follow my disgraces,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if it fed ye! and how sleek and wanton</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye appear in every thing may bring my ruin!</div>
                     <div class="line">Follow your envious courses, men of malice;</div>
                     <div class="line">You have Christian warrant for 'em, and, no doubt,</div>
                     <div class="line">In time will find their fit rewards. That seal,</div>
                     <div class="line">You ask with such a violence, the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine and your master, with his own hand gave me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Bade me enjoy it, with the place and honours,</div>
                     <div class="line">During my life; and, to confirm his goodness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tied it by letters-patents: now, who'll take it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">The king, that gave it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">It must be himself, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a proud traitor, priest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Proud lord, thou liest:</div>
                     <div class="line">Within these forty hours Surrey durst better</div>
                     <div class="line">Have burnt that tongue than said so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy ambition,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou scarlet sin, robb'd this bewailing land</div>
                     <div class="line">Of noble Buckingham, my father-in-law:</div>
                     <div class="line">The heads of all thy brother cardinals,</div>
                     <div class="line">With thee and all thy best parts bound together,</div>
                     <div class="line">Weigh'd not a hair of his. Plague of your policy!</div>
                     <div class="line">You sent me deputy for Ireland;</div>
                     <div class="line">Far from his succor, from the king, from all</div>
                     <div class="line">That might have mercy on the fault thou gavest him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst your great goodness, out of holy pity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Absolved him with an axe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">This, and all else</div>
                     <div class="line">This talking lord can lay upon my credit,</div>
                     <div class="line">I answer is most false. The duke by law</div>
                     <div class="line">Found his deserts: how innocent I was</div>
                     <div class="line">From any private malice in his end,</div>
                     <div class="line">His noble jury and foul cause can witness.</div>
                     <div class="line">If I loved many words, lord, I should tell you</div>
                     <div class="line">You have as little honesty as honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in the way of loyalty and truth</div>
                     <div class="line">Toward the king, my ever royal master,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dare mate a sounder man than Surrey can be,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all that love his follies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">By my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your long coat, priest, protects you; thou</div>
                     <div class="line">shouldst feel</div>
                     <div class="line">My sword i' the life-blood of thee else. My lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Can ye endure to hear this arrogance?</div>
                     <div class="line">And from this fellow? if we live thus tamely,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be thus jaded by a piece of scarlet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell nobility; let his grace go forward,</div>
                     <div class="line">And dare us with his cap like larks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">All goodness</div>
                     <div class="line">Is poison to thy stomach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, that goodness</div>
                     <div class="line">Of gleaning all the land's wealth into one,</div>
                     <div class="line">Into your own hands, cardinal, by extortion;</div>
                     <div class="line">The goodness of your intercepted packets</div>
                     <div class="line">You writ to the pope against the king: your goodness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you provoke me, shall be most notorious.</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of Norfolk, as you are truly noble,</div>
                     <div class="line">As you respect the common good, the state</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our despised nobility, our issues,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, if he live, will scarce be gentlemen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Produce the grand sum of his sins, the articles</div>
                     <div class="line">Collected from his life. I'll startle you</div>
                     <div class="line">Worse than the scaring bell, when the brown wench</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay kissing in your arms, lord cardinal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">How much, methinks, I could despise this man,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that I am bound in charity against it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Those articles, my lord, are in the king's hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, thus much, they are foul ones.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">So much fairer</div>
                     <div class="line">And spotless shall mine innocence arise,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the king knows my truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">This cannot save you:</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank my memory, I yet remember</div>
                     <div class="line">Some of these articles; and out they shall.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, if you can blush and cry 'guilty,' cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll show a little honesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak on, sir;</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare your worst objections: if I blush,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is to see a nobleman want manners.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather want those than my head. Have at you!</div>
                     <div class="line">First, that, without the king's assent or knowledge,</div>
                     <div class="line">You wrought to be a legate; by which power</div>
                     <div class="line">You maim'd the jurisdiction of all bishops.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, that in all you writ to Rome, or else</div>
                     <div class="line">To foreign princes, 'Ego et Rex meus'</div>
                     <div class="line">Was still inscribed; in which you brought the king</div>
                     <div class="line">To be your servant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then that, without the knowledge</div>
                     <div class="line">Either of king or council, when you went</div>
                     <div class="line">Ambassador to the emperor, you made bold</div>
                     <div class="line">To carry into Flanders the great seal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Item, you sent a large commission</div>
                     <div class="line">To Gregory de Cassado, to conclude,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the king's will or the state's allowance,</div>
                     <div class="line">A league between his highness and Ferrara.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">That, out of mere ambition, you have caused</div>
                     <div class="line">Your holy hat to be stamp'd on the king's coin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Then that you have sent innumerable substance--</div>
                     <div class="line">By what means got, I leave to your own conscience--</div>
                     <div class="line">To furnish Rome, and to prepare the ways</div>
                     <div class="line">You have for dignities; to the mere undoing</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all the kingdom. Many more there are;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, since they are of you, and odious,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not taint my mouth with.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">O my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Press not a falling man too far! 'tis virtue:</div>
                     <div class="line">His faults lie open to the laws; let them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not you, correct him. My heart weeps to see him</div>
                     <div class="line">So little of his great self.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                     <div class="line">I forgive him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord cardinal, the king's further pleasure is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because all those things you have done of late,</div>
                     <div class="line">By your power legatine, within this kingdom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall into the compass of a praemunire,</div>
                     <div class="line">That therefore such a writ be sued against you;</div>
                     <div class="line">To forfeit all your goods, lands, tenements,</div>
                     <div class="line">Chattels, and whatsoever, and to be</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the king's protection. This is my charge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                     <div class="line">And so we'll leave you to your meditations</div>
                     <div class="line">How to live better. For your stubborn answer</div>
                     <div class="line">About the giving back the great seal to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king shall know it, and, no doubt, shall thank you.</div>
                     <div class="line">So fare you well, my little good lord cardinal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but CARDINAL WOLSEY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">So farewell to the little good you bear me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell! a long farewell, to all my greatness!</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the state of man: to-day he puts forth</div>
                     <div class="line">The tender leaves of hopes; to-morrow blossoms,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bears his blushing honours thick upon him;</div>
                     <div class="line">The third day comes a frost, a killing frost,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, when he thinks, good easy man, full surely</div>
                     <div class="line">His greatness is a-ripening, nips his root,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then he falls, as I do. I have ventured,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like little wanton boys that swim on bladders,</div>
                     <div class="line">This many summers in a sea of glory,</div>
                     <div class="line">But far beyond my depth: my high-blown pride</div>
                     <div class="line">At length broke under me and now has left me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Weary and old with service, to the mercy</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a rude stream, that must for ever hide me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Vain pomp and glory of this world, I hate ye:</div>
                     <div class="line">I feel my heart new open'd. O, how wretched</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that poor man that hangs on princes' favours!</div>
                     <div class="line">There is, betwixt that smile we would aspire to,</div>
                     <div class="line">That sweet aspect of princes, and their ruin,</div>
                     <div class="line">More pangs and fears than wars or women have:</div>
                     <div class="line">And when he falls, he falls like Lucifer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Never to hope again.</div>
                     <p>Enter CROMWELL, and stands amazed</p>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, Cromwell!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">I have no power to speak, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, amazed</div>
                     <div class="line">At my misfortunes? can thy spirit wonder</div>
                     <div class="line">A great man should decline? Nay, an you weep,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am fall'n indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">How does your grace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, well;</div>
                     <div class="line">Never so truly happy, my good Cromwell.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know myself now; and I feel within me</div>
                     <div class="line">A peace above all earthly dignities,</div>
                     <div class="line">A still and quiet conscience. The king has cured me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I humbly thank his grace; and from these shoulders,</div>
                     <div class="line">These ruin'd pillars, out of pity, taken</div>
                     <div class="line">A load would sink a navy, too much honour:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, 'tis a burthen, Cromwell, 'tis a burthen</div>
                     <div class="line">Too heavy for a man that hopes for heaven!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad your grace has made that right use of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope I have: I am able now, methinks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of a fortitude of soul I feel,</div>
                     <div class="line">To endure more miseries and greater far</div>
                     <div class="line">Than my weak-hearted enemies dare offer.</div>
                     <div class="line">What news abroad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">The heaviest and the worst</div>
                     <div class="line">Is your displeasure with the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">God bless him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">The next is, that Sir Thomas More is chosen</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord chancellor in your place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">That's somewhat sudden:</div>
                     <div class="line">But he's a learned man. May he continue</div>
                     <div class="line">Long in his highness' favour, and do justice</div>
                     <div class="line">For truth's sake and his conscience; that his bones,</div>
                     <div class="line">When he has run his course and sleeps in blessings,</div>
                     <div class="line">May have a tomb of orphans' tears wept on em! What more?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">That Cranmer is return'd with welcome,</div>
                     <div class="line">Install'd lord archbishop of Canterbury.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">That's news indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">Last, that the Lady Anne,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom the king hath in secrecy long married,</div>
                     <div class="line">This day was view'd in open as his queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Going to chapel; and the voice is now</div>
                     <div class="line">Only about her coronation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">There was the weight that pull'd me down. O Cromwell,</div>
                     <div class="line">The king has gone beyond me: all my glories</div>
                     <div class="line">In that one woman I have lost for ever:</div>
                     <div class="line">No sun shall ever usher forth mine honours,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or gild again the noble troops that waited</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my smiles. Go, get thee from me, Cromwell;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a poor fall'n man, unworthy now</div>
                     <div class="line">To be thy lord and master: seek the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">That sun, I pray, may never set! I have told him</div>
                     <div class="line">What and how true thou art: he will advance thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some little memory of me will stir him--</div>
                     <div class="line">I know his noble nature--not to let</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy hopeful service perish too: good Cromwell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neglect him not; make use now, and provide</div>
                     <div class="line">For thine own future safety.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">O my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I, then, leave you? must I needs forego</div>
                     <div class="line">So good, so noble and so true a master?</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear witness, all that have not hearts of iron,</div>
                     <div class="line">With what a sorrow Cromwell leaves his lord.</div>
                     <div class="line">The king shall have my service: but my prayers</div>
                     <div class="line">For ever and for ever shall be yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Cromwell, I did not think to shed a tear</div>
                     <div class="line">In all my miseries; but thou hast forced me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of thy honest truth, to play the woman.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's dry our eyes: and thus far hear me, Cromwell;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, when I am forgotten, as I shall be,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sleep in dull cold marble, where no mention</div>
                     <div class="line">Of me more must be heard of, say, I taught thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, Wolsey, that once trod the ways of glory,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sounded all the depths and shoals of honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Found thee a way, out of his wreck, to rise in;</div>
                     <div class="line">A sure and safe one, though thy master miss'd it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark but my fall, and that that ruin'd me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Cromwell, I charge thee, fling away ambition:</div>
                     <div class="line">By that sin fell the angels; how can man, then,</div>
                     <div class="line">The image of his Maker, hope to win by it?</div>
                     <div class="line">Love thyself last: cherish those hearts that hate thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Corruption wins not more than honesty.</div>
                     <div class="line">Still in thy right hand carry gentle peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">To silence envious tongues. Be just, and fear not:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let all the ends thou aim'st at be thy country's,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy God's, and truth's; then if thou fall'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">O Cromwell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou fall'st a blessed martyr! Serve the king;</div>
                     <div class="line">And,--prithee, lead me in:</div>
                     <div class="line">There take an inventory of all I have,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the last penny; 'tis the king's: my robe,</div>
                     <div class="line">And my integrity to heaven, is all</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare now call mine own. O Cromwell, Cromwell!</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I but served my God with half the zeal</div>
                     <div class="line">I served my king, he would not in mine age</div>
                     <div class="line">Have left me naked to mine enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CROMWELL</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sir, have patience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                     <div class="line">So I have. Farewell</div>
                     <div class="line">The hopes of court! my hopes in heaven do dwell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  A street in Westminster.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Kimbolton.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A street in Westminster.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Gentlemen, meeting one another</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">You're well met once again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">So are you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">You come to take your stand here, and behold</div>
                     <div class="line">The Lady Anne pass from her coronation?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis all my business. At our last encounter,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Buckingham came from his trial.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis very true: but that time offer'd sorrow;</div>
                     <div class="line">This, general joy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis well: the citizens,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sure, have shown at full their royal minds--</div>
                     <div class="line">As, let 'em have their rights, they are ever forward--</div>
                     <div class="line">In celebration of this day with shows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pageants and sights of honour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Never greater,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor, I'll assure you, better taken, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">May I be bold to ask at what that contains,</div>
                     <div class="line">That paper in your hand?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes; 'tis the list</div>
                     <div class="line">Of those that claim their offices this day</div>
                     <div class="line">By custom of the coronation.</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Suffolk is the first, and claims</div>
                     <div class="line">To be high-steward; next, the Duke of Norfolk,</div>
                     <div class="line">He to be earl marshal: you may read the rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you, sir: had I not known those customs,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should have been beholding to your paper.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, I beseech you, what's become of Katharine,</div>
                     <div class="line">The princess dowager? how goes her business?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">That I can tell you too. The Archbishop</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Canterbury, accompanied with other</div>
                     <div class="line">Learned and reverend fathers of his order,</div>
                     <div class="line">Held a late court at Dunstable, six miles off</div>
                     <div class="line">From Ampthill where the princess lay; to which</div>
                     <div class="line">She was often cited by them, but appear'd not:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to be short, for not appearance and</div>
                     <div class="line">The king's late scruple, by the main assent</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all these learned men she was divorced,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the late marriage made of none effect</div>
                     <div class="line">Since which she was removed to Kimbolton,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where she remains now sick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, good lady!</div>
                     <p>Trumpets</p>
                     <div class="line">The trumpets sound: stand close, the queen is coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Hautboys</p>
               <p>THE ORDER OF THE CORONATION</p>
               <p>1. A lively flourish of Trumpets.</p>
               <p>2. Then, two Judges.</p>
               <p>3. Lord Chancellor, with the purse and mace before him.</p>
               <p>4. Choristers, singing.</p>
               <p>Music</p>
               <p>5. Mayor of London, bearing the mace. Then Garter, in his coat of arms, and on his head a gilt copper crown.</p>
               <p>6. Marquess Dorset, bearing a sceptre of gold, on his head a demi-coronal of gold. With him, SURREY, bearing the rod of silver with the dove, crowned with an earl's coronet. Collars of SS.</p>
               <p>7. SUFFOLK, in his robe of estate, his coronet on his head, bearing a long white wand, as high-steward. With him, NORFOLK, with the rod of marshalship, a coronet on his head. Collars of SS.</p>
               <p>8. A canopy borne by four of the Cinque-ports; under it, QUEEN ANNE in her robe; in her hair richly adorned with pearl, crowned. On each side her, the Bishops of London and Winchester.</p>
               <p>9. The old Duchess of Norfolk, in a coronal of gold, wrought with flowers, bearing QUEEN ANNE's train.</p>
               <p>10. Certain Ladies or Countesses, with plain circlets of gold without flowers.</p>
               <p>They pass over the stage in order and state</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">A royal train, believe me. These I know:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's that that bears the sceptre?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Marquess Dorset:</div>
                     <div class="line">And that the Earl of Surrey, with the rod.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">A bold brave gentleman. That should be</div>
                     <div class="line">The Duke of Suffolk?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis the same: high-steward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">And that my Lord of Norfolk?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes;</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven bless thee!</div>
                     <p>Looking on QUEEN ANNE</p>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast the sweetest face I ever look'd on.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, as I have a soul, she is an angel;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our king has all the Indies in his arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">And more and richer, when he strains that lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot blame his conscience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">They that bear</div>
                     <div class="line">The cloth of honour over her, are four barons</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the Cinque-ports.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Those men are happy; and so are all are near her.</div>
                     <div class="line">I take it, she that carries up the train</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that old noble lady, Duchess of Norfolk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">It is; and all the rest are countesses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Their coronets say so. These are stars indeed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And sometimes falling ones.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">No more of that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit procession, and then a great flourish of trumpets</p>
               <p>Enter a third Gentleman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">God save you, sir! where have you been broiling?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Among the crowd i' the Abbey; where a finger</div>
                     <div class="line">Could not be wedged in more: I am stifled</div>
                     <div class="line">With the mere rankness of their joy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">You saw</div>
                     <div class="line">The ceremony?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">That I did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">How was it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Well worth the seeing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sir, speak it to us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">As well as I am able. The rich stream</div>
                     <div class="line">Of lords and ladies, having brought the queen</div>
                     <div class="line">To a prepared place in the choir, fell off</div>
                     <div class="line">A distance from her; while her grace sat down</div>
                     <div class="line">To rest awhile, some half an hour or so,</div>
                     <div class="line">In a rich chair of state, opposing freely</div>
                     <div class="line">The beauty of her person to the people.</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe me, sir, she is the goodliest woman</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever lay by man: which when the people</div>
                     <div class="line">Had the full view of, such a noise arose</div>
                     <div class="line">As the shrouds make at sea in a stiff tempest,</div>
                     <div class="line">As loud, and to as many tunes: hats, cloaks--</div>
                     <div class="line">Doublets, I think,--flew up; and had their faces</div>
                     <div class="line">Been loose, this day they had been lost. Such joy</div>
                     <div class="line">I never saw before. Great-bellied women,</div>
                     <div class="line">That had not half a week to go, like rams</div>
                     <div class="line">In the old time of war, would shake the press,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make 'em reel before 'em. No man living</div>
                     <div class="line">Could say 'This is my wife' there; all were woven</div>
                     <div class="line">So strangely in one piece.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">But, what follow'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">At length her grace rose, and with modest paces</div>
                     <div class="line">Came to the altar; where she kneel'd, and saint-like</div>
                     <div class="line">Cast her fair eyes to heaven and pray'd devoutly.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then rose again and bow'd her to the people:</div>
                     <div class="line">When by the Archbishop of Canterbury</div>
                     <div class="line">She had all the royal makings of a queen;</div>
                     <div class="line">As holy oil, Edward Confessor's crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">The rod, and bird of peace, and all such emblems</div>
                     <div class="line">Laid nobly on her: which perform'd, the choir,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all the choicest music of the kingdom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together sung 'Te Deum.' So she parted,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with the same full state paced back again</div>
                     <div class="line">To York-place, where the feast is held.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">You must no more call it York-place, that's past;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, since the cardinal fell, that title's lost:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis now the king's, and call'd Whitehall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">I know it;</div>
                     <div class="line">But 'tis so lately alter'd, that the old name</div>
                     <div class="line">Is fresh about me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">What two reverend bishops</div>
                     <div class="line">Were those that went on each side of the queen?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Stokesly and Gardiner; the one of Winchester,</div>
                     <div class="line">Newly preferr'd from the king's secretary,</div>
                     <div class="line">The other, London.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">He of Winchester</div>
                     <div class="line">Is held no great good lover of the archbishop's,</div>
                     <div class="line">The virtuous Cranmer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">All the land knows that:</div>
                     <div class="line">However, yet there is no great breach; when it comes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cranmer will find a friend will not shrink from him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Who may that be, I pray you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Thomas Cromwell;</div>
                     <div class="line">A man in much esteem with the king, and truly</div>
                     <div class="line">A worthy friend. The king has made him master</div>
                     <div class="line">O' the jewel house,</div>
                     <div class="line">And one, already, of the privy council.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">He will deserve more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, without all doubt.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, gentlemen, ye shall go my way, which</div>
                     <div class="line">Is to the court, and there ye shall be my guests:</div>
                     <div class="line">Something I can command. As I walk thither,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell ye more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">You may command us, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Kimbolton.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KATHARINE, Dowager, sick; led between
GRIFFITH, her gentleman usher, and PATIENCE, her woman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRIFFITH</div>
                     <div class="line">How does your grace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">O Griffith, sick to death!</div>
                     <div class="line">My legs, like loaden branches, bow to the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Willing to leave their burthen. Reach a chair:</div>
                     <div class="line">So; now, methinks, I feel a little ease.</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou not tell me, Griffith, as thou led'st me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That the great child of honour, Cardinal Wolsey, Was dead?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRIFFITH</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, madam; but I think your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the pain you suffer'd, gave no ear to't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, good Griffith, tell me how he died:</div>
                     <div class="line">If well, he stepp'd before me, happily</div>
                     <div class="line">For my example.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRIFFITH</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, the voice goes, madam:</div>
                     <div class="line">For after the stout Earl Northumberland</div>
                     <div class="line">Arrested him at York, and brought him forward,</div>
                     <div class="line">As a man sorely tainted, to his answer,</div>
                     <div class="line">He fell sick suddenly, and grew so ill</div>
                     <div class="line">He could not sit his mule.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor man!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRIFFITH</div>
                     <div class="line">At last, with easy roads, he came to Leicester,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lodged in the abbey; where the reverend abbot,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all his covent, honourably received him;</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom he gave these words, 'O, father abbot,</div>
                     <div class="line">An old man, broken with the storms of state,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is come to lay his weary bones among ye;</div>
