                     <div class="line">At chamber--door? and one as great as you are?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a shame was this! Did my commission</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid ye so far forget yourselves? I gave ye</div>
                     <div class="line">Power as he was a counsellor to try him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not as a groom: there's some of ye, I see,</div>
                     <div class="line">More out of malice than integrity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would try him to the utmost, had ye mean;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which ye shall never have while I live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chancellor</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus far,</div>
                     <div class="line">My most dread sovereign, may it like your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">To let my tongue excuse all. What was purposed</div>
                     <div class="line">Concerning his imprisonment, was rather,</div>
                     <div class="line">If there be faith in men, meant for his trial,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fair purgation to the world, than malice,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'm sure, in me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well, my lords, respect him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Take him, and use him well, he's worthy of it.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will say thus much for him, if a prince</div>
                     <div class="line">May be beholding to a subject, I</div>
                     <div class="line">Am, for his love and service, so to him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Make me no more ado, but all embrace him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be friends, for shame, my lords! My Lord of</div>
                     <div class="line">Canterbury,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a suit which you must not deny me;</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, a fair young maid that yet wants baptism,</div>
                     <div class="line">You must be godfather, and answer for her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRANMER</div>
                     <div class="line">The greatest monarch now alive may glory</div>
                     <div class="line">In such an honour: how may I deserve it</div>
                     <div class="line">That am a poor and humble subject to you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, my lord, you'ld spare your spoons: you</div>
                     <div class="line">shall have two noble partners with you; the old</div>
                     <div class="line">Duchess of Norfolk, and Lady Marquess Dorset: will</div>
                     <div class="line">these please you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Once more, my Lord of Winchester, I charge you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Embrace and love this man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GARDINER</div>
                     <div class="line">With a true heart</div>
                     <div class="line">And brother-love I do it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRANMER</div>
                     <div class="line">And let heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Witness, how dear I hold this confirmation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Good man, those joyful tears show thy true heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">The common voice, I see, is verified</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thee, which says thus, 'Do my Lord of Canterbury</div>
                     <div class="line">A shrewd turn, and he is your friend for ever.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, lords, we trifle time away; I long</div>
                     <div class="line">To have this young one made a Christian.</div>
                     <div class="line">As I have made ye one, lords, one remain;</div>
                     <div class="line">So I grow stronger, you more honour gain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The palace yard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Noise and tumult within. Enter Porter and his Man</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll leave your noise anon, ye rascals: do you</div>
                     <div class="line">take the court for Paris-garden? ye rude slaves,</div>
                     <div class="line">leave your gaping.</div>
                     <p>Within</p>
                     <div class="line">Good master porter, I belong to the larder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">Belong to the gallows, and be hanged, ye rogue! is</div>
                     <div class="line">this a place to roar in? Fetch me a dozen crab-tree</div>
                     <div class="line">staves, and strong ones: these are but switches to</div>
                     <div class="line">'em. I'll scratch your heads: you must be seeing</div>
                     <div class="line">christenings? do you look for ale and cakes here,</div>
                     <div class="line">you rude rascals?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Man</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray, sir, be patient: 'tis as much impossible--</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless we sweep 'em from the door with cannons--</div>
                     <div class="line">To scatter 'em, as 'tis to make 'em sleep</div>
                     <div class="line">On May-day morning; which will never be:</div>
                     <div class="line">We may as well push against Powle's, as stir em.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">How got they in, and be hang'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Man</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, I know not; how gets the tide in?</div>
                     <div class="line">As much as one sound cudgel of four foot--</div>
                     <div class="line">You see the poor remainder--could distribute,</div>
                     <div class="line">I made no spare, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">You did nothing, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Man</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not Samson, nor Sir Guy, nor Colbrand,</div>
                     <div class="line">To mow 'em down before me: but if I spared any</div>
                     <div class="line">That had a head to hit, either young or old,</div>
                     <div class="line">He or she, cuckold or cuckold-maker,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me ne'er hope to see a chine again</div>
                     <div class="line">And that I would not for a cow, God save her!</div>
                     <p>Within</p>
                     <div class="line">Do you hear, master porter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall be with you presently, good master puppy.</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep the door close, sirrah.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Man</div>
                     <div class="line">What would you have me do?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">What should you do, but knock 'em down by the</div>
                     <div class="line">dozens? Is this Moorfields to muster in? or have</div>
                     <div class="line">we some strange Indian with the great tool come to</div>
                     <div class="line">court, the women so besiege us? Bless me, what a</div>
                     <div class="line">fry of fornication is at door! On my Christian</div>
                     <div class="line">conscience, this one christening will beget a</div>
                     <div class="line">thousand; here will be father, godfather, and all together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Man</div>
                     <div class="line">The spoons will be the bigger, sir. There is a</div>
                     <div class="line">fellow somewhat near the door, he should be a</div>
                     <div class="line">brazier by his face, for, o' my conscience, twenty</div>
                     <div class="line">of the dog-days now reign in's nose; all that stand</div>
                     <div class="line">about him are under the line, they need no other</div>
                     <div class="line">penance: that fire-drake did I hit three times on</div>
                     <div class="line">the head, and three times was his nose discharged</div>
                     <div class="line">against me; he stands there, like a mortar-piece, to</div>
                     <div class="line">blow us. There was a haberdasher's wife of small</div>
                     <div class="line">wit near him, that railed upon me till her pinked</div>
                     <div class="line">porringer fell off her head, for kindling such a</div>
                     <div class="line">combustion in the state. I missed the meteor once,</div>
                     <div class="line">and hit that woman; who cried out 'Clubs!' when I</div>
                     <div class="line">might see from far some forty truncheoners draw to</div>
                     <div class="line">her succor, which were the hope o' the Strand, where</div>
                     <div class="line">she was quartered. They fell on; I made good my</div>
                     <div class="line">place: at length they came to the broom-staff to</div>
                     <div class="line">me; I defied 'em still: when suddenly a file of</div>
                     <div class="line">boys behind 'em, loose shot, delivered such a shower</div>
                     <div class="line">of pebbles, that I was fain to draw mine honour in,</div>
                     <div class="line">and let 'em win the work: the devil was amongst</div>
                     <div class="line">'em, I think, surely.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">These are the youths that thunder at a playhouse,</div>
                     <div class="line">and fight for bitten apples; that no audience, but</div>
                     <div class="line">the tribulation of Tower-hill, or the limbs of</div>
                     <div class="line">Limehouse, their dear brothers, are able to endure.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have some of 'em in Limbo Patrum, and there they</div>
                     <div class="line">are like to dance these three days; besides the</div>
                     <div class="line">running banquet of two beadles that is to come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Chamberlain</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">Mercy o' me, what a multitude are here!</div>
                     <div class="line">They grow still too; from all parts they are coming,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if we kept a fair here! Where are these porters,</div>
                     <div class="line">These lazy knaves? Ye have made a fine hand, fellows:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's a trim rabble let in: are all these</div>
                     <div class="line">Your faithful friends o' the suburbs? We shall have</div>
                     <div class="line">Great store of room, no doubt, left for the ladies,</div>
                     <div class="line">When they pass back from the christening.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">An't please</div>
                     <div class="line">your honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">We are but men; and what so many may do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not being torn a-pieces, we have done:</div>
                     <div class="line">An army cannot rule 'em.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                     <div class="line">As I live,</div>
                     <div class="line">If the king blame me for't, I'll lay ye all</div>
                     <div class="line">By the heels, and suddenly; and on your heads</div>
                     <div class="line">Clap round fines for neglect: ye are lazy knaves;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here ye lie baiting of bombards, when</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye should do service. Hark! the trumpets sound;</div>
                     <div class="line">They're come already from the christening:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, break among the press, and find a way out</div>
                     <div class="line">To let the troop pass fairly; or I'll find</div>
                     <div class="line">A Marshalsea shall hold ye play these two months.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">Make way there for the princess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Man</div>
                     <div class="line">You great fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand close up, or I'll make your head ache.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Porter</div>
                     <div class="line">You i' the camlet, get up o' the rail;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll peck you o'er the pales else.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter trumpets, sounding; then two Aldermen, Lord
Mayor, Garter, CRANMER, NORFOLK with his marshal's
staff, SUFFOLK, two Noblemen bearing great
standing-bowls for the christening-gifts; then
four Noblemen bearing a canopy, under which the
Duchess of Norfolk, godmother, bearing the child
richly habited in a mantle, &c., train borne by a
Lady; then follows the Marchioness Dorset, the
other godmother, and Ladies. The troop pass once
about the stage, and Garter speaks</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Garter</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven, from thy endless goodness, send prosperous</div>
                     <div class="line">life, long, and ever happy, to the high and mighty</div>
                     <div class="line">princess of England, Elizabeth!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VIII and Guard</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRANMER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Kneeling</span> And to your royal grace, and the good queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble partners, and myself, thus pray:</div>
                     <div class="line">All comfort, joy, in this most gracious lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven ever laid up to make parents happy,</div>
                     <div class="line">May hourly fall upon ye!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Thank you, good lord archbishop:</div>
                     <div class="line">What is her name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRANMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Elizabeth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand up, lord.</div>
                     <p>KING HENRY VIII kisses the child</p>
                     <div class="line">With this kiss take my blessing: God protect thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">Into whose hand I give thy life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRANMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble gossips, ye have been too prodigal:</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank ye heartily; so shall this lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">When she has so much English.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRANMER</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me speak, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">For heaven now bids me; and the words I utter</div>
                     <div class="line">Let none think flattery, for they'll find 'em truth.</div>
                     <div class="line">This royal infant--heaven still move about her!--</div>
                     <div class="line">Though in her cradle, yet now promises</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this land a thousand thousand blessings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which time shall bring to ripeness: she shall be--</div>
                     <div class="line">But few now living can behold that goodness--</div>
                     <div class="line">A pattern to all princes living with her,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all that shall succeed: Saba was never</div>
                     <div class="line">More covetous of wisdom and fair virtue</div>
                     <div class="line">Than this pure soul shall be: all princely graces,</div>
                     <div class="line">That mould up such a mighty piece as this is,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all the virtues that attend the good,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall still be doubled on her: truth shall nurse her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Holy and heavenly thoughts still counsel her:</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall be loved and fear'd: her own shall bless her;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her foes shake like a field of beaten corn,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang their heads with sorrow: good grows with her:</div>
                     <div class="line">In her days every man shall eat in safety,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under his own vine, what he plants; and sing</div>
                     <div class="line">The merry songs of peace to all his neighbours:</div>
                     <div class="line">God shall be truly known; and those about her</div>
                     <div class="line">From her shall read the perfect ways of honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by those claim their greatness, not by blood.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor shall this peace sleep with her: but as when</div>
                     <div class="line">The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her ashes new create another heir,</div>
                     <div class="line">As great in admiration as herself;</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall she leave her blessedness to one,</div>
                     <div class="line">When heaven shall call her from this cloud of darkness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who from the sacred ashes of her honour</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall star-like rise, as great in fame as she was,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so stand fix'd: peace, plenty, love, truth, terror,</div>
                     <div class="line">That were the servants to this chosen infant,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall then be his, and like a vine grow to him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherever the bright sun of heaven shall shine,</div>
                     <div class="line">His honour and the greatness of his name</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be, and make new nations: he shall flourish,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a mountain cedar, reach his branches</div>
                     <div class="line">To all the plains about him: our children's children</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall see this, and bless heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou speakest wonders.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CRANMER</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall be, to the happiness of England,</div>
                     <div class="line">An aged princess; many days shall see her,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet no day without a deed to crown it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Would I had known no more! but she must die,</div>
                     <div class="line">She must, the saints must have her; yet a virgin,</div>
                     <div class="line">A most unspotted lily shall she pass</div>
                     <div class="line">To the ground, and all the world shall mourn her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                     <div class="line">O lord archbishop,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast made me now a man! never, before</div>
                     <div class="line">This happy child, did I get any thing:</div>
                     <div class="line">This oracle of comfort has so pleased me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That when I am in heaven I shall desire</div>
                     <div class="line">To see what this child does, and praise my Maker.</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank ye all. To you, my good lord mayor,</div>
                     <div class="line">And your good brethren, I am much beholding;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have received much honour by your presence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ye shall find me thankful. Lead the way, lords:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye must all see the queen, and she must thank ye,</div>
                     <div class="line">She will be sick else. This day, no man think</div>
                     <div class="line">Has business at his house; for all shall stay:</div>
                     <div class="line">This little one shall make it holiday.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.8.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. EPILOGUE</h2>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker"/>
                     <div class="line">'Tis ten to one this play can never please</div>
                     <div class="line">All that are here: some come to take their ease,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sleep an act or two; but those, we fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">We have frighted with our trumpets; so, 'tis clear,</div>
                     <div class="line">They'll say 'tis naught: others, to hear the city</div>
                     <div class="line">Abused extremely, and to cry 'That's witty!'</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we have not done neither: that, I fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">All the expected good we're like to hear</div>
                     <div class="line">For this play at this time, is only in</div>
                     <div class="line">The merciful construction of good women;</div>
                     <div class="line">For such a one we show'd 'em: if they smile,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say 'twill do, I know, within a while</div>
                     <div class="line">All the best men are ours; for 'tis ill hap,</div>
                     <div class="line">If they hold when their ladies bid 'em clap.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
<html>
   <head>
      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/default.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The Famous History of the Life of Henry the Eighth</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Famous History of the Life of Henry the Eighth</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">
               <p>
                  <b>Table of Contents</b>
               </p>
               <ul class="toc">
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.2">1. Dramatis Personae</a>
                     </span>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.3">2. THE PROLOGUE</a>
                     </span>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.4">1. ACT I</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. The council-chamber.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  A Hall in York Place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  An ante-chamber of the QUEEN'S apartments.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  A hall in Black-Friars.</a>
                           </span>

                     </ul>
                  </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>

                           </span>

                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">4. ACT IV</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  A street in Westminster.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Kimbolton.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.8">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.2">1. SCENE I.  London. A gallery in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.3">2. SCENE II.  Before the council-chamber. Pursuivants, Pages, &c. attending.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.4">3. SCENE III.  The Council-Chamber.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.5">4. SCENE IV.  The palace yard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.6">5. SCENE V.  The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.8.7">6. EPILOGUE</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">KING HENRY the Eighth</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CARDINAL WOLSEY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CAPUCIUS, Ambassador from the Emperor Charles V.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CRANMER, Archbishop of Canterbury.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF NORFOLK</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF BUCKINGHAM</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF SUFFOLK</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">EARL OF SURREY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lord Chamberlain</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lord Chancellor</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">GARDINER, Bishop of Winchester.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Bishop of Lincoln. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LORD ABERGAVENNY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LORD SANDS</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR HENRY GUILDFORD</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR THOMAS LOVELL</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR ANTHONY DENNY</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR NICHOLAS VAUX</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Secretaries to Wolsey.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">CROMWELL, Servant to Wolsey.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">GRIFFITH, Gentleman-usher to Queen Katharine.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Three Gentlemen.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DOCTOR BUTTS, Physician to the King.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Garter King-at-Arms. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Surveyor to the Duke of Buckingham. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BRANDON</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Sergeant-at-Arms. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Door-keeper of the Council-chamber. Porter, and his Man. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Page to Gardiner. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Crier. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">QUEEN KATHARINE Wife to King Henry, afterwards</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">divorced. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ANNE BULLEN,  her Maid of Honour, afterwards Queen. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">An old Lady, friend to Anne Bullen. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PATIENCE, woman to Queen Katharine.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Several Lords and Ladies in the Dumb Shows; Women attending upon the Queen; Scribes, Officers, Guards, and other Attendants.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Spirits.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  London; Westminster; Kimbolton</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>THE PROLOGUE</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <div class="dialogue">
                     <div class="linegroup">
                        <div class="speaker"/>
                        <div class="line">I come no more to make you laugh: things now,</div>
                        <div class="line">That bear a weighty and a serious brow,</div>
                        <div class="line">Sad, high, and working, full of state and woe,</div>
                        <div class="line">Such noble scenes as draw the eye to flow,</div>
                        <div class="line">We now present. Those that can pity, here</div>
                        <div class="line">May, if they think it well, let fall a tear;</div>
                        <div class="line">The subject will deserve it. Such as give</div>
                        <div class="line">Their money out of hope they may believe,</div>
                        <div class="line">May here find truth too. Those that come to see</div>
                        <div class="line">Only a show or two, and so agree</div>
                        <div class="line">The play may pass, if they be still and willing,</div>
                        <div class="line">I'll undertake may see away their shilling</div>
                        <div class="line">Richly in two short hours. Only they</div>
                        <div class="line">That come to hear a merry bawdy play,</div>
                        <div class="line">A noise of targets, or to see a fellow</div>
                        <div class="line">In a long motley coat guarded with yellow,</div>
                        <div class="line">Will be deceived; for, gentle hearers, know,</div>
                        <div class="line">To rank our chosen truth with such a show</div>
                        <div class="line">As fool and fight is, beside forfeiting</div>
                        <div class="line">Our own brains, and the opinion that we bring,</div>
                        <div class="line">To make that only true we now intend,</div>
                        <div class="line">Will leave us never an understanding friend.</div>
                        <div class="line">Therefore, for goodness' sake, and as you are known</div>
                        <div class="line">The first and happiest hearers of the town,</div>
                        <div class="line">Be sad, as we would make ye: think ye see</div>
                        <div class="line">The very persons of our noble story</div>
                        <div class="line">As they were living; think you see them great,</div>
                        <div class="line">And follow'd with the general throng and sweat</div>
                        <div class="line">Of thousand friends; then in a moment, see</div>
                        <div class="line">How soon this mightiness meets misery:</div>
                        <div class="line">And, if you can be merry then, I'll say</div>
                        <div class="line">A man may weep upon his wedding-day.</div>
                     </div>
                  </div>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. The council-chamber.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  An ante-chamber in the palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  A Hall in York Place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter NORFOLK at one door; at the other, BUCKINGHAM
and ABERGAVENNY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, and well met. How have ye done</div>
                              <div class="line">Since last we saw in France?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank your grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">Healthful; and ever since a fresh admirer</div>
                              <div class="line">Of what I saw there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">An untimely ague</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay'd me a prisoner in my chamber when</div>
                              <div class="line">Those suns of glory, those two lights of men,</div>
                              <div class="line">Met in the vale of Andren.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twixt Guynes and Arde:</div>
                              <div class="line">I was then present, saw them salute on horseback;</div>
                              <div class="line">Beheld them, when they lighted, how they clung</div>
                              <div class="line">In their embracement, as they grew together;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which had they, what four throned ones could have weigh'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Such a compounded one?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">All the whole time</div>
                              <div class="line">I was my chamber's prisoner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then you lost</div>
                              <div class="line">The view of earthly glory: men might say,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till this time pomp was single, but now married</div>
                              <div class="line">To one above itself. Each following day</div>
                              <div class="line">Became the next day's master, till the last</div>
                              <div class="line">Made former wonders its. To-day the French,</div>
                              <div class="line">All clinquant, all in gold, like heathen gods,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shone down the English; and, to-morrow, they</div>
                              <div class="line">Made Britain India: every man that stood</div>
                              <div class="line">Show'd like a mine. Their dwarfish pages were</div>
                              <div class="line">As cherubins, all guilt: the madams too,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not used to toil, did almost sweat to bear</div>
                              <div class="line">The pride upon them, that their very labour</div>
                              <div class="line">Was to them as a painting: now this masque</div>
                              <div class="line">Was cried incomparable; and the ensuing night</div>
                              <div class="line">Made it a fool and beggar. The two kings,</div>
                              <div class="line">Equal in lustre, were now best, now worst,</div>
                              <div class="line">As presence did present them; him in eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">Still him in praise: and, being present both</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twas said they saw but one; and no discerner</div>
                              <div class="line">Durst wag his tongue in censure. When these suns--</div>
                              <div class="line">For so they phrase 'em--by their heralds challenged</div>
                              <div class="line">The noble spirits to arms, they did perform</div>
                              <div class="line">Beyond thought's compass; that former fabulous story,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being now seen possible enough, got credit,</div>
                              <div class="line">That Bevis was believed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">O, you go far.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">As I belong to worship and affect</div>
                              <div class="line">In honour honesty, the tract of every thing</div>
                              <div class="line">Would by a good discourser lose some life,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which action's self was tongue to. All was royal;</div>
                              <div class="line">To the disposing of it nought rebell'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">Order gave each thing view; the office did</div>
                              <div class="line">Distinctly his full function.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Who did guide,</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, who set the body and the limbs</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this great sport together, as you guess?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">One, certes, that promises no element</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a business.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, who, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">All this was order'd by the good discretion</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the right reverend Cardinal of York.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">The devil speed him! no man's pie is freed</div>
                              <div class="line">From his ambitious finger. What had he</div>
                              <div class="line">To do in these fierce vanities? I wonder</div>
                              <div class="line">That such a keech can with his very bulk</div>
                              <div class="line">Take up the rays o' the beneficial sun</div>
                              <div class="line">And keep it from the earth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Surely, sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">There's in him stuff that puts him to these ends;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, being not propp'd by ancestry, whose grace</div>
                              <div class="line">Chalks successors their way, nor call'd upon</div>
                              <div class="line">For high feats done to the crown; neither allied</div>
                              <div class="line">For eminent assistants; but, spider-like,</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of his self-drawing web, he gives us note,</div>
                              <div class="line">The force of his own merit makes his way</div>
                              <div class="line">A gift that heaven gives for him, which buys</div>
                              <div class="line">A place next to the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot tell</div>
                              <div class="line">What heaven hath given him,--let some graver eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Pierce into that; but I can see his pride</div>
                              <div class="line">Peep through each part of him: whence has he that,</div>
                              <div class="line">If not from hell? the devil is a niggard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or has given all before, and he begins</div>
                              <div class="line">A new hell in himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Why the devil,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon this French going out, took he upon him,</div>
                              <div class="line">Without the privity o' the king, to appoint</div>
                              <div class="line">Who should attend on him? He makes up the file</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all the gentry; for the most part such</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom as great a charge as little honour</div>
                              <div class="line">He meant to lay upon: and his own letter,</div>
                              <div class="line">The honourable board of council out,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must fetch him in the papers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                              <div class="line">I do know</div>
                              <div class="line">Kinsmen of mine, three at the least, that have</div>
                              <div class="line">By this so sickened their estates, that never</div>
                              <div class="line">They shall abound as formerly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">O, many</div>
                              <div class="line">Have broke their backs with laying manors on 'em</div>
                              <div class="line">For this great journey. What did this vanity</div>
                              <div class="line">But minister communication of</div>
                              <div class="line">A most poor issue?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Grievingly I think,</div>
                              <div class="line">The peace between the French and us not values</div>
                              <div class="line">The cost that did conclude it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Every man,</div>
                              <div class="line">After the hideous storm that follow'd, was</div>
                              <div class="line">A thing inspired; and, not consulting, broke</div>
                              <div class="line">Into a general prophecy; That this tempest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dashing the garment of this peace, aboded</div>
                              <div class="line">The sudden breach on't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is budded out;</div>
                              <div class="line">For France hath flaw'd the league, and hath attach'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Our merchants' goods at Bourdeaux.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it therefore</div>
                              <div class="line">The ambassador is silenced?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, is't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABERGAVENNY</div>
                              <div class="line">A proper title of a peace; and purchased</div>
                              <div class="line">At a superfluous rate!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, all this business</div>
                              <div class="line">Our reverend cardinal carried.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Like it your grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">The state takes notice of the private difference</div>
                              <div class="line">Betwixt you and the cardinal. I advise you--</div>
                              <div class="line">And take it from a heart that wishes towards you</div>
                              <div class="line">Honour and plenteous safety--that you read</div>
                              <div class="line">The cardinal's malice and his potency</div>
                              <div class="line">Together; to consider further that</div>
                              <div class="line">What his high hatred would effect wants not</div>
                              <div class="line">A minister in his power. You know his nature,</div>
                              <div class="line">That he's revengeful, and I know his sword</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath a sharp edge: it's long and, 't may be said,</div>
                              <div class="line">It reaches far, and where 'twill not extend,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thither he darts it. Bosom up my counsel,</div>
                              <div class="line">You'll find it wholesome. Lo, where comes that rock</div>
                              <div class="line">That I advise your shunning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY, the purse borne before him,
certain of the Guard, and two Secretaries with
papers. CARDINAL WOLSEY in his passage fixeth his
eye on BUCKINGHAM, and BUCKINGHAM on him, both full
of disdain</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">The Duke of Buckingham's surveyor, ha?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where's his examination?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Secretary</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, so please you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Is he in person ready?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Secretary</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, please your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, we shall then know more; and Buckingham</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall lessen this big look.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt CARDINAL WOLSEY and his Train</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">This butcher's cur is venom-mouth'd, and I</div>
                              <div class="line">Have not the power to muzzle him; therefore best</div>
                              <div class="line">Not wake him in his slumber. A beggar's book</div>
                              <div class="line">Outworths a noble's blood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">What, are you chafed?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ask God for temperance; that's the appliance only</div>
                              <div class="line">Which your disease requires.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I read in's looks</div>
                              <div class="line">Matter against me; and his eye reviled</div>
                              <div class="line">Me, as his abject object: at this instant</div>
                              <div class="line">He bores me with some trick: he's gone to the king;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll follow and outstare him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let your reason with your choler question</div>
                              <div class="line">What 'tis you go about: to climb steep hills</div>
                              <div class="line">Requires slow pace at first: anger is like</div>
                              <div class="line">A full-hot horse, who being allow'd his way,</div>
                              <div class="line">Self-mettle tires him. Not a man in England</div>
                              <div class="line">Can advise me like you: be to yourself</div>
                              <div class="line">As you would to your friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll to the king;</div>
                              <div class="line">And from a mouth of honour quite cry down</div>
                              <div class="line">This Ipswich fellow's insolence; or proclaim</div>
                              <div class="line">There's difference in no persons.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Be advised;</div>
                              <div class="line">Heat not a furnace for your foe so hot</div>
                              <div class="line">That it do singe yourself: we may outrun,</div>
                              <div class="line">By violent swiftness, that which we run at,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lose by over-running. Know you not,</div>
                              <div class="line">The fire that mounts the liquor til run o'er,</div>
                              <div class="line">In seeming to augment it wastes it? Be advised:</div>
                              <div class="line">I say again, there is no English soul</div>
                              <div class="line">More stronger to direct you than yourself,</div>
                              <div class="line">If with the sap of reason you would quench,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or but allay, the fire of passion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am thankful to you; and I'll go along</div>
                              <div class="line">By your prescription: but this top-proud fellow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom from the flow of gall I name not but</div>
                              <div class="line">From sincere motions, by intelligence,</div>
                              <div class="line">And proofs as clear as founts in July when</div>
                              <div class="line">We see each grain of gravel, I do know</div>
                              <div class="line">To be corrupt and treasonous.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Say not 'treasonous.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">To the king I'll say't; and make my vouch as strong</div>
                              <div class="line">As shore of rock. Attend. This holy fox,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or wolf, or both,--for he is equal ravenous</div>
                              <div class="line">As he is subtle, and as prone to mischief</div>
                              <div class="line">As able to perform't; his mind and place</div>
                              <div class="line">Infecting one another, yea, reciprocally--</div>
                              <div class="line">Only to show his pomp as well in France</div>
                              <div class="line">As here at home, suggests the king our master</div>
                              <div class="line">To this last costly treaty, the interview,</div>
                              <div class="line">That swallow'd so much treasure, and like a glass</div>
                              <div class="line">Did break i' the rinsing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, and so it did.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray, give me favour, sir. This cunning cardinal</div>
                              <div class="line">The articles o' the combination drew</div>
                              <div class="line">As himself pleased; and they were ratified</div>
                              <div class="line">As he cried 'Thus let be': to as much end</div>
                              <div class="line">As give a crutch to the dead: but our count-cardinal</div>
                              <div class="line">Has done this, and 'tis well; for worthy Wolsey,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who cannot err, he did it. Now this follows,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, as I take it, is a kind of puppy</div>
                              <div class="line">To the old dam, treason,--Charles the emperor,</div>
                              <div class="line">Under pretence to see the queen his aunt--</div>
                              <div class="line">For 'twas indeed his colour, but he came</div>
                              <div class="line">To whisper Wolsey,--here makes visitation:</div>
                              <div class="line">His fears were, that the interview betwixt</div>
                              <div class="line">England and France might, through their amity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Breed him some prejudice; for from this league</div>
                              <div class="line">Peep'd harms that menaced him: he privily</div>
                              <div class="line">Deals with our cardinal; and, as I trow,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I do well; for I am sure the emperor</div>
                              <div class="line">Paid ere he promised; whereby his suit was granted</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere it was ask'd; but when the way was made,</div>
                              <div class="line">And paved with gold, the emperor thus desired,</div>
                              <div class="line">That he would please to alter the king's course,</div>
                              <div class="line">And break the foresaid peace. Let the king know,</div>
                              <div class="line">As soon he shall by me, that thus the cardinal</div>
                              <div class="line">Does buy and sell his honour as he pleases,</div>
                              <div class="line">And for his own advantage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sorry</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear this of him; and could wish he were</div>
                              <div class="line">Something mistaken in't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not a syllable:</div>
                              <div class="line">I  do pronounce him in that very shape</div>
                              <div class="line">He shall appear in proof.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BRANDON, a Sergeant-at-arms before him, and
two or three of the Guard</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                              <div class="line">Your office, sergeant; execute it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sergeant</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord the Duke of Buckingham, and Earl</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Hereford, Stafford, and Northampton, I</div>
                              <div class="line">Arrest thee of high treason, in the name</div>
                              <div class="line">Of our most sovereign king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, you, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">The net has fall'n upon me! I shall perish</div>
                              <div class="line">Under device and practise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sorry</div>
                              <div class="line">To see you ta'en from liberty, to look on</div>
                              <div class="line">The business present: 'tis his highness' pleasure</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall to the Tower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">It will help me nothing</div>
                              <div class="line">To plead mine innocence; for that dye is on me</div>
                              <div class="line">Which makes my whitest part black. The will of heaven</div>
                              <div class="line">Be done in this and all things! I obey.</div>
                              <div class="line">O my Lord Abergavenny, fare you well!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRANDON</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, he must bear you company. The king</div>
                              <p>To ABERGAVENNY</p>
                              <div class="line">Is pleased you shall to the Tower, till you know</div>
                              <div class="line">How he determines further.</div>
                           </div>
