                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Is he found guilty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, truly is he, and condemn'd upon't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sorry for't.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">So are a number more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">But, pray, how pass'd it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell you in a little. The great duke</div>
                              <div class="line">Came to the bar; where to his accusations</div>
                              <div class="line">He pleaded still not guilty and alleged</div>
                              <div class="line">Many sharp reasons to defeat the law.</div>
                              <div class="line">The king's attorney on the contrary</div>
                              <div class="line">Urged on the examinations, proofs, confessions</div>
                              <div class="line">Of divers witnesses; which the duke desired</div>
                              <div class="line">To have brought viva voce to his face:</div>
                              <div class="line">At which appear'd against him his surveyor;</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Gilbert Peck his chancellor; and John Car,</div>
                              <div class="line">Confessor to him; with that devil-monk,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hopkins, that made this mischief.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">That was he</div>
                              <div class="line">That fed him with his prophecies?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">The same.</div>
                              <div class="line">All these accused him strongly; which he fain</div>
                              <div class="line">Would have flung from him, but, indeed, he could not:</div>
                              <div class="line">And so his peers, upon this evidence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have found him guilty of high treason. Much</div>
                              <div class="line">He spoke, and learnedly, for life; but all</div>
                              <div class="line">Was either pitied in him or forgotten.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">After all this, how did he bear himself?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">When he was brought again to the bar, to hear</div>
                              <div class="line">His knell rung out, his judgment, he was stirr'd</div>
                              <div class="line">With such an agony, he sweat extremely,</div>
                              <div class="line">And something spoke in choler, ill, and hasty:</div>
                              <div class="line">But he fell to himself again, and sweetly</div>
                              <div class="line">In all the rest show'd a most noble patience.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not think he fears death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Sure, he does not:</div>
                              <div class="line">He never was so womanish; the cause</div>
                              <div class="line">He may a little grieve at.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Certainly</div>
                              <div class="line">The cardinal is the end of this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis likely,</div>
                              <div class="line">By all conjectures: first, Kildare's attainder,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then deputy of Ireland; who removed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Earl Surrey was sent thither, and in haste too,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest he should help his father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">That trick of state</div>
                              <div class="line">Was a deep envious one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">At his return</div>
                              <div class="line">No doubt he will requite it. This is noted,</div>
                              <div class="line">And generally, whoever the king favours,</div>
                              <div class="line">The cardinal instantly will find employment,</div>
                              <div class="line">And far enough from court too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">All the commons</div>
                              <div class="line">Hate him perniciously, and, o' my conscience,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wish him ten fathom deep: this duke as much</div>
                              <div class="line">They love and dote on; call him bounteous Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">The mirror of all courtesy;--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay there, sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">And see the noble ruin'd man you speak of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM from his arraignment; tip-staves
before him; the axe with the edge towards him;
halberds on each side: accompanied with LOVELL,
VAUX, SANDS, and common people</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's stand close, and behold him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">All good people,</div>
                              <div class="line">You that thus far have come to pity me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear what I say, and then go home and lose me.</div>
                              <div class="line">I have this day received a traitor's judgment,</div>
                              <div class="line">And by that name must die: yet, heaven bear witness,</div>
                              <div class="line">And if I have a conscience, let it sink me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even as the axe falls, if I be not faithful!</div>
                              <div class="line">The law I bear no malice for my death;</div>
                              <div class="line">'T has done, upon the premises, but justice:</div>
                              <div class="line">But those that sought it I could wish more Christians:</div>
                              <div class="line">Be what they will, I heartily forgive 'em:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet let 'em look they glory not in mischief,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor build their evils on the graves of great men;</div>
                              <div class="line">For then my guiltless blood must cry against 'em.</div>
                              <div class="line">For further life in this world I ne'er hope,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor will I sue, although the king have mercies</div>
                              <div class="line">More than I dare make faults. You few that loved me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And dare be bold to weep for Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">His noble friends and fellows, whom to leave</div>
                              <div class="line">Is only bitter to him, only dying,</div>
                              <div class="line">Go with me, like good angels, to my end;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as the long divorce of steel falls on me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Make of your prayers one sweet sacrifice,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lift my soul to heaven. Lead on, o' God's name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LOVELL</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech your grace, for charity,</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever any malice in your heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Were hid against me, now to forgive me frankly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Thomas Lovell, I as free forgive you</div>
                              <div class="line">As I would be forgiven: I forgive all;</div>
                              <div class="line">There cannot be those numberless offences</div>
                              <div class="line">'Gainst me, that I cannot take peace with:</div>
                              <div class="line">no black envy</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall mark my grave. Commend me to his grace;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if he speak of Buckingham, pray, tell him</div>
                              <div class="line">You met him half in heaven: my vows and prayers</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet are the king's; and, till my soul forsake,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall cry for blessings on him: may he live</div>
                              <div class="line">Longer than I have time to tell his years!</div>
                              <div class="line">Ever beloved and loving may his rule be!</div>
                              <div class="line">And when old time shall lead him to his end,</div>
                              <div class="line">Goodness and he fill up one monument!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LOVELL</div>
                              <div class="line">To the water side I must conduct your grace;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then give my charge up to Sir Nicholas Vaux,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who undertakes you to your end.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VAUX</div>
                              <div class="line">Prepare there,</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke is coming: see the barge be ready;</div>
                              <div class="line">And fit it with such furniture as suits</div>
                              <div class="line">The greatness of his person.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, Sir Nicholas,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.</div>
                              <div class="line">When I came hither, I was lord high constable</div>
                              <div class="line">And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet I am richer than my base accusers,</div>
                              <div class="line">That never knew what truth meant: I now seal it;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with that blood will make 'em one day groan for't.</div>
                              <div class="line">My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who first raised head against usurping Richard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Flying for succor to his servant Banister,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying</div>
                              <div class="line">My father's loss, like a most royal prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">Restored me to my honours, and, out of ruins,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made my name once more noble. Now his son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name and all</div>
                              <div class="line">That made me happy at one stroke has taken</div>
                              <div class="line">For ever from the world. I had my trial,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, must needs say, a noble one; which makes me,</div>
                              <div class="line">A little happier than my wretched father:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both</div>
                              <div class="line">Fell by our servants, by those men we loved most;</div>
                              <div class="line">A most unnatural and faithless service!</div>
                              <div class="line">Heaven has an end in all: yet, you that hear me,</div>
                              <div class="line">This from a dying man receive as certain:</div>
                              <div class="line">Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels</div>
                              <div class="line">Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends</div>
                              <div class="line">And give your hearts to, when they once perceive</div>
                              <div class="line">The least rub in your fortunes, fall away</div>
                              <div class="line">Like water from ye, never found again</div>
                              <div class="line">But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray for me! I must now forsake ye: the last hour</div>
                              <div class="line">Of my long weary life is come upon me. Farewell:</div>
                              <div class="line">And when you would say something that is sad,</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and Train</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">O, this is full of pity! Sir, it calls,</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear, too many curses on their beads</div>
                              <div class="line">That were the authors.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">If the duke be guiltless,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis full of woe: yet I can give you inkling</div>
                              <div class="line">Of an ensuing evil, if it fall,</div>
                              <div class="line">Greater than this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Good angels keep it from us!</div>
                              <div class="line">What may it be? You do not doubt my faith, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">This secret is so weighty, 'twill require</div>
                              <div class="line">A strong faith to conceal it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me have it;</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not talk much.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">I am confident,</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall, sir: did you not of late days hear</div>
                              <div class="line">A buzzing of a separation</div>
                              <div class="line">Between the king and Katharine?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, but it held not:</div>
                              <div class="line">For when the king once heard it, out of anger</div>
                              <div class="line">He sent command to the lord mayor straight</div>
                              <div class="line">To stop the rumor, and allay those tongues</div>
                              <div class="line">That durst disperse it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">But that slander, sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is found a truth now: for it grows again</div>
                              <div class="line">Fresher than e'er it was; and held for certain</div>
                              <div class="line">The king will venture at it. Either the cardinal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or some about him near, have, out of malice</div>
                              <div class="line">To the good queen, possess'd him with a scruple</div>
                              <div class="line">That will undo her: to confirm this too,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cardinal Campeius is arrived, and lately;</div>
                              <div class="line">As all think, for this business.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis the cardinal;</div>
                              <div class="line">And merely to revenge him on the emperor</div>
                              <div class="line">For not bestowing on him, at his asking,</div>
                              <div class="line">The archbishopric of Toledo, this is purposed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">I think you have hit the mark: but is't not cruel</div>
                              <div class="line">That she should feel the smart of this? The cardinal</div>
                              <div class="line">Will have his will, and she must fall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis woful.</div>
                              <div class="line">We are too open here to argue this;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's think in private more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  An ante-chamber in the palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter Chamberlain, reading a letter</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">'My lord, the horses your lordship sent for, with</div>
                              <div class="line">all the care I had, I saw well chosen, ridden, and</div>
                              <div class="line">furnished. They were young and handsome, and of the</div>
                              <div class="line">best breed in the north. When they were ready to</div>
                              <div class="line">set out for London, a man of my lord cardinal's, by</div>
                              <div class="line">commission and main power, took 'em from me; with</div>
                              <div class="line">this reason: His master would be served before a</div>
                              <div class="line">subject, if not before the king; which stopped our</div>
                              <div class="line">mouths, sir.'</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear he will indeed: well, let him have them:</div>
                              <div class="line">He will have all, I think.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter, to Chamberlain, NORFOLK and SUFFOLK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Well met, my lord chamberlain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">Good day to both your graces.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">How is the king employ'd?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">I left him private,</div>
                              <div class="line">Full of sad thoughts and troubles.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">What's the cause?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">It seems the marriage with his brother's wife</div>
                              <div class="line">Has crept too near his conscience.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">No, his conscience</div>
                              <div class="line">Has crept too near another lady.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis so:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the cardinal's doing, the king-cardinal:</div>
                              <div class="line">That blind priest, like the eldest son of fortune,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turns what he list. The king will know him one day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray God he do! he'll never know himself else.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">How holily he works in all his business!</div>
                              <div class="line">And with what zeal! for, now he has crack'd the league</div>
                              <div class="line">Between us and the emperor, the queen's great nephew,</div>
                              <div class="line">He dives into the king's soul, and there scatters</div>
                              <div class="line">Dangers, doubts, wringing of the conscience,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fears, and despairs; and all these for his marriage:</div>
                              <div class="line">And out of all these to restore the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">He counsels a divorce; a loss of her</div>
                              <div class="line">That, like a jewel, has hung twenty years</div>
                              <div class="line">About his neck, yet never lost her lustre;</div>
                              <div class="line">Of her that loves him with that excellence</div>
                              <div class="line">That angels love good men with; even of her</div>
                              <div class="line">That, when the greatest stroke of fortune falls,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will bless the king: and is not this course pious?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">Heaven keep me from such counsel! 'Tis most true</div>
                              <div class="line">These news are every where; every tongue speaks 'em,</div>
                              <div class="line">And every true heart weeps for't: all that dare</div>
                              <div class="line">Look into these affairs see this main end,</div>
                              <div class="line">The French king's sister. Heaven will one day open</div>
                              <div class="line">The king's eyes, that so long have slept upon</div>
                              <div class="line">This bold bad man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">And free us from his slavery.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">We had need pray,</div>
                              <div class="line">And heartily, for our deliverance;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or this imperious man will work us all</div>
                              <div class="line">From princes into pages: all men's honours</div>
                              <div class="line">Lie like one lump before him, to be fashion'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Into what pitch he please.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">For me, my lords,</div>
                              <div class="line">I love him not, nor fear him; there's my creed:</div>
                              <div class="line">As I am made without him, so I'll stand,</div>
                              <div class="line">If the king please; his curses and his blessings</div>
                              <div class="line">Touch me alike, they're breath I not believe in.</div>
                              <div class="line">I knew him, and I know him; so I leave him</div>
                              <div class="line">To him that made him proud, the pope.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's in;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with some other business put the king</div>
                              <div class="line">From these sad thoughts, that work too much upon him:</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, you'll bear us company?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">Excuse me;</div>
                              <div class="line">The king has sent me otherwhere: besides,</div>
                              <div class="line">You'll find a most unfit time to disturb him:</div>
                              <div class="line">Health to your lordships.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, my good lord chamberlain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit Chamberlain; and KING HENRY VIII draws the
curtain, and sits reading pensively</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">How sad he looks! sure, he is much afflicted.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's there, ha?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray God he be not angry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Who's there, I say? How dare you thrust yourselves</div>
                              <div class="line">Into my private meditations?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who am I? ha?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">A gracious king that pardons all offences</div>
                              <div class="line">Malice ne'er meant: our breach of duty this way</div>
                              <div class="line">Is business of estate; in which we come</div>
                              <div class="line">To know your royal pleasure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Ye are too bold:</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to; I'll make ye know your times of business:</div>
                              <div class="line">Is this an hour for temporal affairs, ha?</div>
                              <p>Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY and CARDINAL CAMPEIUS, with
a commission</p>
                              <div class="line">Who's there? my good lord cardinal? O my Wolsey,</div>
                              <div class="line">The quiet of my wounded conscience;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art a cure fit for a king.</div>
                              <p>To CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</p>
                              <div class="line">You're welcome,</div>
                              <div class="line">Most learned reverend sir, into our kingdom:</div>
                              <div class="line">Use us and it.</div>
                              <p>To CARDINAL WOLSEY</p>
                              <div class="line">My good lord, have great care</div>
                              <div class="line">I be not found a talker.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, you cannot.</div>
                              <div class="line">I would your grace would give us but an hour</div>
                              <div class="line">Of private conference.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To NORFOLK and SUFFOLK</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">We are busy; go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to SUFFOLK</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">This priest has no pride in him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to NORFOLK</span>             Not to speak of:</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not be so sick though for his place:</div>
                              <div class="line">But this cannot continue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to SUFFOLK</span>      If it do,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll venture one have-at-him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SUFFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to NORFOLK</span>          I another.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt NORFOLK and SUFFOLK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace has given a precedent of wisdom</div>
                              <div class="line">Above all princes, in committing freely</div>
                              <div class="line">Your scruple to the voice of Christendom:</div>
                              <div class="line">Who can be angry now? what envy reach you?</div>
                              <div class="line">The Spaniard, tied blood and favour to her,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must now confess, if they have any goodness,</div>
                              <div class="line">The trial just and noble. All the clerks,</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean the learned ones, in Christian kingdoms</div>
                              <div class="line">Have their free voices: Rome, the nurse of judgment,</div>
                              <div class="line">Invited by your noble self, hath sent</div>
                              <div class="line">One general tongue unto us, this good man,</div>
                              <div class="line">This just and learned priest, Cardinal Campeius;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom once more I present unto your highness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">And once more in mine arms I bid him welcome,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thank the holy conclave for their loves:</div>
                              <div class="line">They have sent me such a man I would have wish'd for.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace must needs deserve all strangers' loves,</div>
                              <div class="line">You are so noble. To your highness' hand</div>
                              <div class="line">I tender my commission; by whose virtue,</div>
                              <div class="line">The court of Rome commanding, you, my lord</div>
                              <div class="line">Cardinal of York, are join'd with me their servant</div>
                              <div class="line">In the unpartial judging of this business.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Two equal men. The queen shall be acquainted</div>
                              <div class="line">Forthwith for what you come. Where's Gardiner?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">I know your majesty has always loved her</div>
                              <div class="line">So dear in heart, not to deny her that</div>
                              <div class="line">A woman of less place might ask by law:</div>
                              <div class="line">Scholars allow'd freely to argue for her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and the best she shall have; and my favour</div>
                              <div class="line">To him that does best: God forbid else. Cardinal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prithee, call Gardiner to me, my new secretary:</div>
                              <div class="line">I find him a fit fellow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit CARDINAL WOLSEY</p>
                        <p>Re-enter CARDINAL WOLSEY, with GARDINER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to GARDINER</span>  Give me your hand much joy and</div>
                              <div class="line">favour to you;</div>
                              <div class="line">You are the king's now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GARDINER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to CARDINAL WOLSEY</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">But to be commanded</div>
                              <div class="line">For ever by your grace, whose hand has raised me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, Gardiner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Walks and whispers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of York, was not one Doctor Pace</div>
                              <div class="line">In this man's place before him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, he was.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Was he not held a learned man?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, surely.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe me, there's an ill opinion spread then</div>
                              <div class="line">Even of yourself, lord cardinal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">How! of me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL CAMPEIUS</div>
                              <div class="line">They will not stick to say you envied him,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fearing he would rise, he was so virtuous,</div>
                              <div class="line">Kept him a foreign man still; which so grieved him,</div>
                              <div class="line">That he ran mad and died.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Heaven's peace be with him!</div>
                              <div class="line">That's Christian care enough: for living murmurers</div>
                              <div class="line">There's places of rebuke. He was a fool;</div>
                              <div class="line">For he would needs be virtuous: that good fellow,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I command him, follows my appointment:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will have none so near else. Learn this, brother,</div>
                              <div class="line">We live not to be grip'd by meaner persons.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Deliver this with modesty to the queen.</div>
                              <p>Exit GARDINER</p>
                              <div class="line">The most convenient place that I can think of</div>
                              <div class="line">For such receipt of learning is Black-Friars;</div>
                              <div class="line">There ye shall meet about this weighty business.</div>
                              <div class="line">My Wolsey, see it furnish'd. O, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would it not grieve an able man to leave</div>
                              <div class="line">So sweet a bedfellow? But, conscience, conscience!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, 'tis a tender place; and I must leave her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  An ante-chamber of the QUEEN'S apartments.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter ANNE and an Old Lady</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Not for that neither: here's the pang that pinches:</div>
                              <div class="line">His highness having lived so long with her, and she</div>
                              <div class="line">So good a lady that no tongue could ever</div>
                              <div class="line">Pronounce dishonour of her; by my life,</div>
                              <div class="line">She never knew harm-doing: O, now, after</div>
                              <div class="line">So many courses of the sun enthroned,</div>
                              <div class="line">Still growing in a majesty and pomp, the which</div>
                              <div class="line">To leave a thousand-fold more bitter than</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis sweet at first to acquire,--after this process,</div>
                              <div class="line">To give her the avaunt! it is a pity</div>
                              <div class="line">Would move a monster.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Hearts of most hard temper</div>
                              <div class="line">Melt and lament for her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">O, God's will! much better</div>
                              <div class="line">She ne'er had known pomp: though't be temporal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, if that quarrel, fortune, do divorce</div>
                              <div class="line">It from the bearer, 'tis a sufferance panging</div>
                              <div class="line">As soul and body's severing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, poor lady!</div>
                              <div class="line">She's a stranger now again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">So much the more</div>
                              <div class="line">Must pity drop upon her. Verily,</div>
                              <div class="line">I swear, 'tis better to be lowly born,</div>
                              <div class="line">And range with humble livers in content,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than to be perk'd up in a glistering grief,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wear a golden sorrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Our content</div>
                              <div class="line">Is our best having.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">By my troth and maidenhead,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not be a queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Beshrew me, I would,</div>
                              <div class="line">And venture maidenhead for't; and so would you,</div>
                              <div class="line">For all this spice of your hypocrisy:</div>
                              <div class="line">You, that have so fair parts of woman on you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have too a woman's heart; which ever yet</div>
                              <div class="line">Affected eminence, wealth, sovereignty;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, to say sooth, are blessings; and which gifts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Saving your mincing, the capacity</div>
                              <div class="line">Of your soft cheveril conscience would receive,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you might please to stretch it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, good troth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, troth, and troth; you would not be a queen?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not for all the riches under heaven.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis strange: a three-pence bow'd would hire me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Old as I am, to queen it: but, I pray you,</div>
                              <div class="line">What think you of a duchess? have you limbs</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear that load of title?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">No, in truth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Then you are weakly made: pluck off a little;</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not be a young count in your way,</div>
                              <div class="line">For more than blushing comes to: if your back</div>
                              <div class="line">Cannot vouchsafe this burthen,'tis too weak</div>
                              <div class="line">Ever to get a boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">How you do talk!</div>
                              <div class="line">I swear again, I would not be a queen</div>
                              <div class="line">For all the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, for little England</div>
                              <div class="line">You'ld venture an emballing: I myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Would for Carnarvonshire, although there long'd</div>
                              <div class="line">No more to the crown but that. Lo, who comes here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Chamberlain</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, ladies. What were't worth to know</div>
                              <div class="line">The secret of your conference?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">My good lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not your demand; it values not your asking:</div>
                              <div class="line">Our mistress' sorrows we were pitying.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">It was a gentle business, and becoming</div>
                              <div class="line">The action of good women: there is hope</div>
                              <div class="line">All will be well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, I pray God, amen!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">You bear a gentle mind, and heavenly blessings</div>
                              <div class="line">Follow such creatures. That you may, fair lady,</div>
                              <div class="line">Perceive I speak sincerely, and high note's</div>
                              <div class="line">Ta'en of your many virtues, the king's majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">Commends his good opinion of you, and</div>
                              <div class="line">Does purpose honour to you no less flowing</div>
                              <div class="line">Than Marchioness of Pembroke: to which title</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand pound a year, annual support,</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of his grace he adds.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not know</div>
                              <div class="line">What kind of my obedience I should tender;</div>
                              <div class="line">More than my all is nothing: nor my prayers</div>
                              <div class="line">Are not words duly hallow'd, nor my wishes</div>
                              <div class="line">More worth than empty vanities; yet prayers and wishes</div>
                              <div class="line">Are all I can return. Beseech your lordship,</div>
                              <div class="line">Vouchsafe to speak my thanks and my obedience,</div>
                              <div class="line">As from a blushing handmaid, to his highness;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose health and royalty I pray for.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Chamberlain</div>
                              <div class="line">Lady,</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall not fail to approve the fair conceit</div>
                              <div class="line">The king hath of you.</div>
                              <p>Aside</p>
                              <div class="line">I have perused her well;</div>
                              <div class="line">Beauty and honour in her are so mingled</div>
                              <div class="line">That they have caught the king: and who knows yet</div>
                              <div class="line">But from this lady may proceed a gem</div>
                              <div class="line">To lighten all this isle? I'll to the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">And say I spoke with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit Chamberlain</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">My honour'd lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, this it is; see, see!</div>
                              <div class="line">I have been begging sixteen years in court,</div>
                              <div class="line">Am yet a courtier beggarly, nor could</div>
                              <div class="line">Come pat betwixt too early and too late</div>
                              <div class="line">For any suit of pounds; and you, O fate!</div>
                              <div class="line">A very fresh-fish here--fie, fie, fie upon</div>
                              <div class="line">This compell'd fortune!--have your mouth fill'd up</div>
                              <div class="line">Before you open it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">This is strange to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">How tastes it? is it bitter? forty pence, no.</div>
                              <div class="line">There was a lady once, 'tis an old story,</div>
                              <div class="line">That would not be a queen, that would she not,</div>
                              <div class="line">For all the mud in Egypt: have you heard it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, you are pleasant.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">With your theme, I could</div>
                              <div class="line">O'ermount the lark. The Marchioness of Pembroke!</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand pounds a year for pure respect!</div>
                              <div class="line">No other obligation! By my life,</div>
                              <div class="line">That promises moe thousands: honour's train</div>
                              <div class="line">Is longer than his foreskirt. By this time</div>
                              <div class="line">I know your back will bear a duchess: say,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you not stronger than you were?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Good lady,</div>
                              <div class="line">Make yourself mirth with your particular fancy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave me out on't. Would I had no being,</div>
                              <div class="line">If this salute my blood a jot: it faints me,</div>
                              <div class="line">To think what follows.</div>
                              <div class="line">The queen is comfortless, and we forgetful</div>
                              <div class="line">In our long absence: pray, do not deliver</div>
                              <div class="line">What here you've heard to her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Old Lady</div>
                              <div class="line">What do you think me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  A hall in Black-Friars.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Trumpets, sennet, and cornets. Enter two Vergers,
with short silver wands; next them, two Scribes, in
the habit of doctors; after them, CANTERBURY alone;
after him, LINCOLN, Ely, Rochester, and Saint
Asaph; next them, with some small distance, follows
a Gentleman bearing the purse, with the great seal,
and a cardinal's hat; then two Priests, bearing
each a silver cross; then a Gentleman-usher
bare-headed, accompanied with a Sergeant-at-arms
bearing a silver mace; then two Gentlemen bearing
two great silver pillars; after them, side by side,
CARDINAL WOLSEY and CARDINAL CAMPEIUS; two Noblemen
with the sword and mace. KING HENRY VIII takes
place under the cloth of state; CARDINAL WOLSEY and
CARDINAL CAMPEIUS sit under him as judges. QUEEN
KATHARINE takes place some distance from KING
HENRY VIII. The Bishops place themselves on each
side the court, in manner of a consistory; below
them, the Scribes. The Lords sit next the Bishops.
The rest of the Attendants stand in convenient
order about the stage</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst our commission from Rome is read,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let silence be commanded.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">What's the need?</div>
                              <div class="line">It hath already publicly been read,</div>
                              <div class="line">And on all sides the authority allow'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">You may, then, spare that time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL WOLSEY</div>
                              <div class="line">Be't so. Proceed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Scribe</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, Henry King of England, come into the court.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Crier</div>
                              <div class="line">Henry King of England, &c.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING HENRY VIII</div>
                              <div class="line">Here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Scribe</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, Katharine Queen of England, come into the court.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Crier</div>
                              <div class="line">Katharine Queen of England, &c.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>QUEEN KATHARINE makes no answer, rises out of her
chair, goes about the court, comes to KING HENRY
VIII, and kneels at his feet; then speaks</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN KATHARINE</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I desire you do me right and justice;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to bestow your pity on me: for</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a most poor woman, and a stranger,</div>
                              <div class="line">Born out of your dominions; having here</div>
                              <div class="line">No judge indifferent, nor no more assurance</div>
                              <div class="line">Of equal friendship and proceeding. Alas, sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">In what have I offended you? what cause</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath my behavior given to your displeasure,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thus you should proceed to put me off,</div>
                              <div class="line">And take your good grace from me? Heaven witness,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have been to you a true and humble wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">At all times to your will conformable;</div>
                              <div class="line">Ever in fear to kindle your dislike,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, subject to your countenance, glad or sorry</div>
                              <div class="line">As I saw it inclined: when was the hour</div>
                              <div class="line">I ever contradicted your desire,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or made it not mine too? Or which of your friends</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I not strove to love, although I knew</div>
                              <div class="line">He were mine enemy? what friend of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">That had to him derived your anger, did I</div>
